title: Corporate Intern - Strategy/Internal Consulting
requirements:
Welcome to Ross Stores, Inc., where our differences make us stronger… At Ross and dd’s, inclusion is a way of life. We care about our Associates and the communities we serve and we value their differences. We are committed to building diverse teams and an inclusive culture. We respect and celebrate the diversity of backgrounds, identities, and ideas of those who work and shop with us. Come join us as we continue our diversity, equality and inclusion journey!

General Purpose

As a Corporate Intern at Ross you will have the opportunity to experience the world of off-price retail and be a part of a growing Fortune 500 company. This position is based in Dublin, California at our corporate headquarters. This internship prepares students for a potential career in retail, allowing you a real-world perspective on a career at Ross. Interns will gain insight into the objectives of their department and the daily responsibilities of an analyst at Ross.

Skills

The ideal Intern candidate for the Strategy Department will have an interest in management consulting and business strategy and will possess the following skills

Intellectual curiosity (candidate proactively pursues learning opportunities)
A clear understanding of basic business, financial, statistical, and economic concepts
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Strong written and oral communication skills
Able to work effectively both individually and as a member of a team

The Strategy Intern will gain exposure to multiple areas of the business, interaction with Senior Leadership, project management experience and the opportunity to learn new software.

Strategy Serves Two Main Functions

"Internal consulting": Strategy supports other departments on projects where they do not have either the capacity or the analytical capabilities to do the work themselves. Strategy's role includes managing cross-functional teams, breaking down complex problems, and communicating with executives.
Business strategy: Strategy is responsible for analyzing the external environment (competitors, consumer preferences, and the economy) in an effort to develop long-term strategic growth options and competitive responses to industry forces.

Examples Of Possible Projects Include

Business performance drivers - Analyze various performance metrics (often at the store level) including sales, transactions, and inventory
Consumer research - Conduct and analyze quantitative and qualitative consumer research in order to better understand our customers' attitudes and behavior (e.g. which product categories are most important to shoppers, how do customers view Ross vs. our competitors)
Cross-functional initiatives - Collaborate with other departments to conduct analyses for key executive-level priorities (e.g. new store format improvement, roll-out strategy for new business opportunities)

Intern Program Outline

The Ross Intern program is a 10-week full-time program (40 hours per week) for college level Juniors, starting in early June ending mid-August. The Intern Program will cover training on project related responsibilities, ownership of a department related project as well as exposure to senior leadership and other departments within Ross corporate.

The main component of the internship will be to analyze a business project within your department while participating in daily department activities. Interns will be expected to present a final project analysis and presentation.

Competencies
Problem Solving
Communication
Learning on the Fly
Time Management
Integrity
Excel / PPT Skills

Qualifications And Special Skills Required
Must currently be enrolled in 4-year college degree program; must currently be in Junior standing with expected graduation between December 2021 and August 2022
MS Office with strong practical application of Excel skills
Ability to demonstrate use of PowerPoint skills
Strong analytical skills with spreadsheet applications
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Able to work in a fast paced environment
Organized and detail-oriented
Retail experience a plus

Physical Requirements/Ada

Job requires ability to work in an office environment, primarily on a computer.
Requires sitting, standing, walking, hearing, talking on the telephone, attending in-person meetings, typing, and working with paper/files, etc.
Consistent timeliness and regular attendance.
Vision requirements: Ability to see information in print and/or electronically.

DISCLAIMER
This position description is a summary of the primary duties and responsibilities of the job and position. It is not intended to be a comprehensive or all-inclusive listing of duties and responsibilities. Contents are subject to change at management's discretion.

Ross is an equal employment opportunity employer. We consider individuals for employment or promotion according to their skills, abilities and experience. We believe that it is an essential part of the Company's overall commitment to attract, hire and develop a strong, talented and diverse workforce. Ross is committed to complying with all applicable laws prohibiting discrimination based on race, color, religious creed, age, national origin, ancestry, physical, mental or developmental disability, sex (which includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth or breastfeeding), veteran status, military status, marital or registered domestic partnership status, medical condition (including cancer or genetic characteristics), genetic information, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, as well as any other category protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Corporate Strategy Intern
requirements:
Corporate Strategy Intern

Corporate Development and Strategy Team | Chegg
Remote, United States

Your goal - to improve the education process and better the lives of students -- by interning in Chegg’s Corporate Development and Strategy group.

Organization: Corporate Development and Strategy

The Corporate Development and Strategy team is an integral part of Chegg - We work closely with the C-team to develop and execute the company’s overall strategy. Execution of strategy includes making decisions around whether the company should buy, build or partner, and therefore is closely tied to the Corporate Development function. Our small team is comprised of analysts, strategists, thought leaders, relationship builders, and dealmakers. The team drives to an understanding of relevant markets, builds out the landscape, sources deals, negotiates and closes transactions, and then develops and manages the integration plan. We also conduct market and competitive research into education trends and areas of future opportunity.

Role: Corporate Development and Strategy Intern

We’re looking for a highly motivated intern to help our team work on strategic projects in concert with the company’s business and product leaders. You will conduct research in support of our strategic roadmap and work across a number of business units, including Learning Services, Skills, and Life. The right candidate will be a self-starter with strong organizational skills and have the ability to think critically about industry and company trends.

Responsibilities
Research EdTech trends to help determine areas of opportunity and further develop our thesis on the education market and its competitive landscape
Analyze other education companies and make assessments regarding their potential as partners, competitors, investment candidates, or acquisition opportunities
Support strategic initiatives such as international expansion, product and audience expansion, partnerships, and investment opportunities
Partner with business and product leaders to develop business cases
Present key findings and recommendations to executives

Requirements
A rising sophomore or junior currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in business, finance, economics, or a related field from an accredited four-year college or university
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder).
Have the ability to work for a continuous 12 weeks in the summer
Have the ability to work 40 hours per week
Strong analytical and communication skills
Advanced knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)
Self-motivated; independent, organized and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple teams; interest in Chegg’s mission
Ability to think critically and work autonomously in both well-defined and ambiguous project environments

Nice To Have
Experience with market research and business analysis
Demonstrated passion for education and technology
Project or internship experience in investment banking, private equity, venture capital, or consulting
Project or internship experience in the education industry
What project will the intern work on?

The strategy intern will support a variety of initiatives, including contributing to the strategic planning of Chegg’s expansion into new international markets for our Learning Services and Skills business units and new non-academic verticals related to our Life business unit. Through primary and secondary research, the intern will develop an understanding of our focus markets, map the competitive landscape in each of these markets, and meaningfully shape Chegg’s entry strategy in these markets. Through their support of these initiatives, the intern will work closely with the Strategy & Corporate development team, as well as cross-functionally with a variety of Chegg’s business units.

What skills will the intern gain?
Advanced Excel
Market research
Business analysis
Basic accounting

See what it’s like to be a Chegg intern!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cp1m_ZtOT_4

Learn more about Chegg!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YYHnkwiD7Oo

About Chegg

Chegg puts students first. As the leading connected learning platform, the company makes higher education more affordable, more accessible, and more successful for students. Chegg is a publicly-held company based in Santa Clara, California, and trades on the NYSE under the symbol CHGG. For more information, visit www.chegg.com.

Chegg is an equal opportunity employer

title: Consulting Intern
requirements:
At Woodard & Curran, there’s nothing we love more than a tough engineering challenge. We handle a wide range of water and environmental issues—solving complex problems with creativity and tenacity. That’s how we make a difference to our clients, people, and planet. Our company was founded on a simple concept: provide a safe and enjoyable place to work with opportunity, integrity, and commitment, and we will attract talented people. Those people are at the heart of our firm, solving some of the most pressing water and environmental challenges for our clients.

Responsibilities

We are looking for a motivated Software Engineering Intern to join our company. If you want to jumpstart your career and expand your skills while working alongside talented experts, then this is the opportunity for you! You will be involved with project work from your first day, working side-by-side with experienced engineers, planners, and scientists to help clients address their water and environmental challenges. Exercise your creativity and problem solving skills in a supportive environment where every perspective is valued. We are a mission-driven organization that puts our people first, with a culture that focuses on providing meaningful work, engaging challenges, recognition, and reward.

Duties and responsibilities vary based on level of experience and project expectations. An intern will generally shadow experienced professionals and participate as a member of a team by contributing to actual projects. Interns are able to apply what they have learned “from the classroom” via experience based-learning.

This Internship Position will be based in our Sacramento, CA Office.

Qualifications

The ideal candidate will be a second or third year Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar with interest in environmental, sustainability, or water resources data management t.

You will need to attach a professional cover letter, as well as your resume. Your resume should include your GPA as well as a sample of courses that you’ve taken at college.

Woodard & Curran is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.

Woodard & Curran is a Drug Free Work Place.

Individuals with Disabilities and Protected Veterans are encouraged to apply.

requirements:

At certain point of your studies you are making decisions about your future career considering all kinds of information, listening to friends and close people, but there is nothing like your own experience. An internship at PwC not only offers an opportunity to build your skills and confidence, but also to work on client projects that give you insight into who we are and what we do whether for our clients, the economy, or the wider community. Working alongside specialists in your chosen business area, you’ll be a valued member of the team, with graduate level responsibility. You’ll be assigned to client projects to develop your understanding of what we really do and you’ll build networks with your colleagues and peer groups. Whichever business area you choose, we’re sure you’ll find this a worthwhile investment of your time. Be it the clients; the people; the networks; or the social events, you’ll be surprised at the skills you’ll develop and how much you’ll learn. Opportunity is at the heart of a career at PwC and our Internship offers just that.

To really stand out and make us ﬁt for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be an authentic and inclusive leader, at all grades/levels and in all lines of service. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.

Responsibilities

PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to

As an Intern / Trainee, you’ll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution.
Learn about how PwC works as a business and adds value to clients.
Think broadly and ask questions about data, facts and other information.
Use tools, techniques and firm standard methodologies to support research, analysis and problem solving.
Produce high quality work which adheres to the relevant professional standards.
Keep up-to-date with technical developments for business area.
Communicate confidently in a clear, concise and articulate manner - verbally and in written form.
Embrace diverse perspectives and welcome opposing and conflicting ideas.
Uphold the firm’s code of ethics and business conduct.

Master of Business Administration

To be eligible for this Internship, students must be entering into their 1st year of MBA school, pursuing a Masters in Business Administration.

Other

3 year(s)

title: Consulting Intern
requirements:

Own communications with the customer throughout the implementation process.

title: Boston College 2021 Campus Summer Intern
requirements:
Ankura is a team of excellence founded on innovation and growth.

About Ankura: Ankura is an expert services firm defined by HOW we solve challenges. Whether a client is facing an immediate business challenge, trying to increase the value of their company or protect against future risks, Ankura designs, develops, and executes tailored solutions by assembling the right combination of expertise. We build on this experience with every case, client, and situation, collaborating to create innovative, customized solutions, and strategies designed for today’s ever-changing business environment. This gives our clients unparalleled insight and experience across a wide range of economic, governance, and regulatory challenges. At Ankura, we know that collaboration drives results.

Position: Ankura Summer Intern

Description: The Summer Internship Program has been created to give students an opportunity to learn what life as a consultant is like at Ankura. As an Intern, you will work on a variety of projects with different engagement teams. The program aims to give you exposure to the breadth of our services and client work. You will work closely with our professionals – Consultants through Director – and gain first-hand experience in consulting.

Business Groups
Construction, Disputes & Advisory: As a Construction Intern, you will develop analytical skills while being immersed in the world of client services. Construction Interns work directly with project team leaders and experts, assisting our experts in performing the detailed analyses required to provide the best solutions for our clients. Interns perform project schedule, cost, productivity, and statistical analyses as well as assist with review of key project issues through document review and database creation/management.
Data & Technology: Interns will be engaged on a variety of projects, internal initiatives, training opportunities and technical challenges, office-wide intern projects, and various social events. The internship program is focused on providing interns with the opportunity to learn about Ankura and the industry, learn and utilize new skills, and develop relationships. Interns will have the opportunity to learn, use, or gain exposure to a wide variety of programs, platforms, and programming languages, including SQL, Python, C#, VBA, and Tableau.
Disputes & Economics: Intern assignments will involve work in fact-finding, allocating costs, analyzing damages, organizing information, or helping to manage data. You will also learn new skills and participate in social and volunteer activities throughout the summer.
Risk, Forensics & Compliance: An ideal intern candidate should have an interest in forensic accounting, investigations, litigation consulting, as well as other related areas described above. Responsibilities will include applying technical accounting, forensic accounting, and analytical skills to various client situations. As an intern, Ankura will provide the opportunity to experience a variety of projects working collaboratively on small, diverse teams with skilled, intelligent, driven, and successful individuals.
Turnaround & Restructuring: T&R is an exciting, fast-paced environment in which our professionals’ partner with clients to address critical issues including over-levered balance sheets, liquidity constraints, unprofitable business units, and adverse industry conditions. Clients rely on Ankura professionals to solve complex challenges with the expectation that they will quickly assess the situation, develop a strategic plan, and effectively execute the turnaround. Our Summer Interns will be an integral part of our project teams.
Qualifications: Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Business Analytics, MIS, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or another analytical area of study; analytical problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset; ability to utilize technology to solve complex problems

Ankura is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment where mutual respect and collaboration is paramount. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, protected veteran status, national origin, or any other legally protected status.

title: Spring/Summer Internships 2021
requirements:
United States of America - California, Los Angeles

Job Summary

Graduates, interns and co-ops are key to the overall success of AECOM. We invest in initial career experience of graduates, interns and co-ops through the summer internship program and various other development opportunities. This serves as the foundation to building our pipeline of future leaders

Additionally, through offering opportunities via our initial career experience programs, we also intend to showcase the nature of our industry to our future leaders and provide you with an opportunity to work on projects that improve the lives of people around the world and in the communities in which we live in.

Please note that this posting is not for a specific opening; we are building a database of qualified candidates for future opportunities. That being said, positions open up typically Jan-March for Intern and Graduate opportunities, this database will allow us to be more proactive in acting quickly on our search. If a position opens, we will use this database to begin our search.

Your resume should be no more than one to two pages and should include (as a minimum) the following:

Join us and meet people who share your drive to make an impact and experience a unique culture where you belong and can shine. At AECOM you will develop essential skills and broaden your perspective alongside caring, fun and expert teammates. You will find that everyone here is not only passionate about ‘what’ we do but about the greater impact of our work and turning challenges into opportunities

Minimum Requirements

We expect our candidates to be graduating with Bachelors or Master’s degree in or related to one of the following degree disciplines: Architecture, Chemical, Civil, Transportation, Construction, Electrical, Geotechnical, Mechanical, Science (s), Structural, and Water Engineering/Science/Design fields. Please note that some positions will require a minimum of a Master’s degree whereas some of them are happy to accept applications from Bachelor degree students. All positions, unless otherwise stated, require students to be permanent residents of the United States.

Preferred Qualifications

Most positions require a minimum GPA of 3.0, but can be flexible depending on location and hiring business group.

What We Offer

When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is pioneering the future. Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions inclusion, diversity and overall employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only delivering a better world, but working to “make amazing happen” in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

Job Category Engineering

Business Line Corporate

Business Group Design and Consulting Services Group (DCS)

Country United States of America

Position Status Intern / Student

Requisition/Vacancy No. 239669BR

Clearance Required No

Virtual: No

title: Private Equity Internship
requirements:
This internship is presented by InternPi, a premium internship placement service provider to college students and new graduates. Please visit www.InternPi.com for more positions.

Below is an internship opportunity from a company within our employer network.

Job Title: Private Equity Intern
Salary: Unpaid
Location: Remote
Start Time: Flexible
Time Commitment: 6 weeks internship, minimum 15 hours/week during academic year

About Company: It is a private equity firm focused on acquiring small to mid-sized businesses in the U.S. The members on leadership team have invested in excess of $2.5 billion of equity capital across seed, venture, growth equity, and buyout rounds globally.

Internship Description: The Intern will be responsible for conducting industry research, evaluating potential new investments, and detailed financial modelling. Primary responsibilities and lessons learned will include:
• Research projects related to potential investments and developing core thesis around attractive end-markets and industries
• Analyzing financial statements
• Financial modelling in Excel (LBO and cashflow)
• Leading market research efforts
• Professional communications and company analysis (consulting level quality)

• Jumpstart your career in finance
• Broaden your professional skill sets in a competitive market
• Gain valuable career coaching from experienced private equity professionals
• Help you focus on your post-graduation career plans

Qualifications: We are looking for intelligent, enthusiastic applicants with a passion for investing and desire to learn independently. The successful individual must be comfortable taking on significant responsibility and also good at communicating/presenting his or her thoughts in writing. Those with a background or demonstrated interest and knowledge in finance/economics, chemistry/physics, or computer science are preferred.

title: Intern
requirements:
About CBRE

The company serves real estate investors and occupiers through approximately 530+ offices worldwide (excluding affiliates). Examples And Will Vary According To Role

title: Consulting Marketing Summer Intern
requirements:

title: Innovation Consulting Internship
requirements:
HR Directions seeks a prospect for its client RTI International for the Innovation Consulting Internship within the Innovation Advisors Group.

RTI's Innovation Advisors perform analyses and research to provide intelligence for a variety of client needs, from informing new product or market development efforts to identifying new manufacturing capabilities or practices. The Innovation Advisors Team also provides research and analysis to identify commercialization opportunities for technologies that are developed by government laboratories and corporations. See https://rtiinnovationadvisors.org/ for more information about our team.

The Innovation Consulting Intern will be mentored by and work with the Innovation Advisors and staff to conduct tasks related to market research and commercialization of new technologies that are often outside the scope of a candidate's current study or experience.

Responsibilities
Conduct research using secondary resources (published company information, SEC filings, scholarly journals, trade literature, and news articles), as well as primary resources (phone interviews) when needed
Provide insightful analysis of opportunities identified during primary and secondary research in written and oral
Develop marketing descriptions of new technologies and conduct research in a wide range of technology areas and industries
Understand business and legal issues related to commercialization of new technologies
Apply general technical acumen and scientific skills to evaluate a variety of technologies

RTI's Internship Program emphasizes experiential and mentored learning experiences, providing students and recent degree recipients an opportunity to apply their academic knowledge and skills in a meaningful and practical way. We are committed to developing the future workforce by encouraging interns to explore various career paths in a nonprofit research institute setting that values diversity and inclusion. Through this program, interns will be exposed to RTI's open and educational culture; support RTI's mission to improve the human condition; and build upon their career goals.

Additional Information

This paid virtual internship will take place from June 2021 through August 2021. The internship requires a minimum commitment of 15 hours per week. Hours are flexible during business hours, Monday through Friday.

Required Qualifications
At minimum, must be a currently enrolled undergraduate student or recent degree recipient (within one-year of post graduation for the full entirety of the internship placement) in a science or engineering field
Demonstrated comfort and willingness to regularly work outside the scope of the candidate's technical field of study, including communication with technical experts
Detail-oriented and able to work independently and collaboratively as part of a team
Exceptional written and oral communication, time management, and analytical skills


Preferred Qualifications
Currently enrolled student or recent graduate of a science or business graduate degree program (such as a master's program in entrepreneurship or engineering management)
Experience or career interest in innovation, technology commercialization and consulting
Knowledge of or previous experience with product or process development, portfolio mapping/valuation, market research, technology evaluation, and/or technology transfer
Experience in chemistry, food science, or consumer packaged goods (including product design and/or industrial design) is a plus

title: Business Development Intern
requirements:
Markacy Overview: Markacy is a digital strategy firm based out of New York City that partners with digitally powered consumer brands to help them achieve financial results. Our cross-functional team supports clients across media, CRM, web/mobile development, design, creative, branding, analytics, marketplace expansion, and financial planning. Our ability to combine strategy consulting, finance, and digital marketing sets us apart from traditional marketing agencies, as does our track record of financial results. We are disrupting the traditional digital marketing model by providing an elevated service focused on tangible impacts.

Role Mission: We are looking for a business development intern to join our rapidly growing team! A minimum availability of 2-3 days per week is required.

Core Responsibilities:
working with senior leadership and the business development to help execute strategic growth priorities across virtual events, networking, outbound/inbound sales support, and thought leadership
support new business opportunities including proposals and pitch deck creation
support content creation efforts including our weekly video series and market research reports
collaborate with team members across CRM, media, creative, and growth to support new business development and content creation opportunities

Minimum Requirements:
going into senior year of college/university, or recent graduate
pursuing or earned bachelor's degree in business administration, economics, marketing, or a similar field
strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
strong interpersonal and communication skills
strong attention to detail, project management and timeline management
solid presentation skills with an ability to tailor communications to a range of audiences
experience in sales and/or comfort with significant ambiguity
entrepreneurial and achievement/career-focused mindset

Individual Competencies:
Efficiency. Able to produce significant output with menial wasted effort. 
Drive. Strives for personal and professional development.
Honesty/Integrity. Does not cut corners ethically. Earns trust and maintains the confidence of those around him/her. Does what is right, not just what is politically expedient.
Organization and planning. Plans, organizes, schedules, and budgets in an efficient and productive manner. Focuses on key priorities and client success.
Aggressiveness. Moves quickly and takes a forceful stand without being overly abrasive to accomplish client and Markacy objectives. 
Follow-through on commitments. Lives up to verbal and written agreements, regardless of personal cost. 
Intelligence. Learn quickly. Demonstrates ability to quickly and proficiently understand and absorb new information. 
Analytical skills. Able to structure and process qualitative or quantitative data and draw insightful conclusions from it. Exhibits a probing mind and achieves penetrating insights. 
Attention to detail. Does not let important details slip through the cracks or derail a project.
Persistence. Demonstrates tenacity and willingness to go the distance to get something done.
Proactivity. Acts without being told what to do. Brings new ideas to the company.

Cultural Competencies:
Clients first. Building long-term sustainable relationships with our clients and delivering tangible growth results over multiple years is our daily north star.
Teamwork. Consulting is a team sport. We work together to make our clients better, support our team-members and drive innovative change. 
Data-driven. We don’t have hunches. We let the data do the talking and set specific KPIs with clients so we know what good looks like and where opportunities lie.
Cross-Channel. Growth is a full-time support and it takes an integrated cross-channel strategy. Our different teams work closely together to bring more integrated solutions to the table for our clients.
Innovation. We started Markacy to disrupt the marketing industry and create an agency solution that high-growth companies could actually scale with.
Entrepreneurial. We have big aspirations but will always embrace start-up tendencies and bring a scrappy, solution-oriented mindset to our work.
Hard-Working. We don’t shy away from hard work; we embrace it as we believe it is a key requisite for individual and team success.

requirements:

title: Public Engagement Intern
requirements:
Public Engagement Intern (032104)

Looking for an opportunity to expand your communications and engagement skill set with the public and stakeholders throughout the Midwest? Do you enjoy gathering meaningful and inclusive feedback that is used to drive project results? If so, we are looking for someone like you to join our team as a Public Engagement Intern in our Minneapolis office.

SRF Consulting Group, Inc. is a growing multi-disciplinary consulting firm providing planning, engineering, and landscape architecture services throughout the Midwest.  Specific service areas of multi-modal and sustainable transportation include street and intersection design, transit design and planning, corridor and safety studies, trails and greenways. Our award-winning company is regularly recognized for excellence in engineering, planning and landscape architecture.

As a Public Engagement Intern, you will collaborate with our Public Engagement team, along with a diverse group of planners, engineers, and designers to create and execute engagement plans for our projects. You will help to develop engagement and communications strategies tailored to the communities we are working in. You will also assist with the preparation of materials for engagement events and activities, along with analyzing the feedback gathered to understand how it should inform the planning or design process.

This opportunity is great for students, offering the power to earn money while developing valuable career skills and gaining practical experience. Looking ahead to the future? SRF Consulting Group may consider the Intern for full-time employment after graduation.

Responsibilities:

Contributing to the development of public engagement plans and communications strategies that are accessible to all community members.
Developing engagement event materials and promotional strategies including press releases, social media advertisements, and presentations.
Assisting with the facilitation of engagement events.
Analyzing engagement and preparing summary documentation.

Qualifications:

Interest in meaningful and inclusive engagement strategies.
Pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Communications, Public Affairs, Public Relations, Marketing, or Urban Planning.
Strong written and verbal communications skills.
Collaborative and enthusiastic attitude.
Good analytical and critical thinking skills.
Good organizational skills with attention to detail.

Please note school transcripts will be requested and reviewed to ensure relevant qualifications for candidates being considered for an interview.

Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

SRF Consulting Group, Inc., is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. Women, minorities, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

At IBTCI you will be part of an inclusive team that provides expert solutions and advice to understand and address critical problems while giving you opportunities to succeed and grow.

Department/Location Crisis, Conflict and Governance/ Vienna, VA

Reports To Manager

Type Regular Part-Time

(IBTCI), a US-based international development consulting company, is seeking an Intern- International Project and Proposal Support (IPPS) to work remotely. title: HR People and Leadership Internship
requirements:
Now’s our time to inspire the future of healthcare together.

At Siemens Healthineers, we are passionate about enabling healthcare professionals to deliver high quality patient care, and to do so affordably. A leading global healthcare company, Siemens Healthineers continues to strengthen our portfolio of medical imaging and laboratory diagnostics, while adding new offerings such as managed services, consulting, and healthcare IT services – as well as further technologies in the growing market for therapeutic and molecular diagnostics.

Siemens Healthineers develops innovations that support better patient outcomes with greater efficiencies, giving providers the confidence, they need to meet the clinical, operational and financial challenges of a changing healthcare landscape. Join our team now at Siemens Healthineers as an HR People & Leadership Intern.

This internship position offers a unique opportunity to learn and gain experiences in specific areas of Human Resources within Siemens. Part of a dynamic strategic team, the intern can deepen their knowledge working for a global company and learn how to adapt to regional and global cultural differences.

Responsibilities

Employee Engagement and Culture
Provide HR support to impact our culture and employee experience by managing day-to-day tasks and long-term projects and processes.
Support projects that aim to increase engagement in our cultural aspirations
Provide support in driving the Diversity & Inclusion (D&I) strategy
Work alongside team to execute and drive a Great Place to Work culture in the Americas region
Work collaboratively with the HR Community on development and engagement topics
Research best practice in the areas of talent development, talent management, and organizational effectiveness.
Coordinate analysis of the engagement survey

Required skills to have for the success of this role
Rising junior or senior currently enrolled in a bachelor’s program or a student currently enrolled in a master’s program
Majors: Human Resources, Psychology, Business Administration, or related discipline
Must have permanent work authorization
Must have a minimum GPA of 3.2
Must be able to work full-time (up to 40 hours) in the summer and feel comfortable working in a fully virtual environment
Start Date: May 2021; 3-4 month duration.

At Siemens Healthineers, we value those who dedicate their energy and passion to a greater cause. Our people make us unique as an employer in the med-tech industry. What unites and motivates our global team is the inspiration of our common purpose: To innovate for healthcare, building on our remarkable legacy of pioneering ideas that translate into even better healthcare products and services. We recognize that taking ownership of our work allows both us and the company to grow. We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment and the space to move beyond your comfort zone to grow both personally and professionally.

U.S. citizen

title: Consultant Engineer Internship
requirements:
Overview

More information about this job:

FM Global is one of the world's largest commercial and industrial property insurance and risk management organizations specializing in property protection. More than one out of every three Fortune 1000 companies, as well as leading international corporations, benefit from FM Global's superior financial strength, policy coverage, risk management skills and extensive expertise in loss prevention engineering and research. Ranked 447 on the FORTUNE 500 list of America’s largest companies, FM Global employs more than 5,400 employees worldwide, including 1,900 loss prevention engineers.

Imagine a career in which you are having one-of-a-kind work experiences helping clients identify and understand what could go wrong. Our Consultant Engineers evaluate risk and reward, calculate potential disaster and anticipate ways to protect against nature’s greatest forces. Built on trust, communication and technology, we will give you the training to work with a large variety of clients to protect their business operations from fire, natural disasters, mechanical breakdown and other types of property risk.

Responsibilities

If you enjoy variety, put your time‐management and organization skills to use partaking in field visits, office work, and projects.

Through special projects, job shadowing, and real work, both in the office and out in the field, you can enhance your skills and build knowledge. At FM Global, you'll deepen your practical engineering knowledge and pave your road to success by taking an immersive journey into our business.

Explore our unique business model and key differentiators through training, research, and first-hand experience. Shadow employees in a range of departments, attend meetings, and experience being a part of the FM Global team. Gain exposure to our training program for consultant engineers, access on-demand learning sessions across a range of topics. Learn how to apply our loss prevention standards for FM Global clients. Join our engineers in the field and live a "day in the life" of a consultant engineer. Assist with special projects and see how engineering data is used throughout the company.

The Intern Would Be Responsible For, But Not Limited To, The Following

During the internship, you will be given assignments of limited scope and complexity giving you the opportunity to learn.
Participating in FM Global training to learn the fundamentals of building construction, occupancy, protection and exposures (COPE) as it relates to risk assessment and risk mitigation.
Learning the fundamentals of fire protection systems.
Trailing FM Global Field Engineers during their visits to commercial properties of varying complexity and learn how to perform “hands‐on” site assessments of the physical property, including roofs.
Reviewing mechanical and electrical equipment operation, installation, maintenance, and loss potential hazards.
Communicating basic recommendations and/or engineering solutions to ensure client understanding and agreement for risk improvement.
Documenting risk analysis of locations visited.
Leading and delivering a technical project to be determined by FM Global Supervisors.
Shadowing professionals in various departments within FM Global to gain a holistic understanding of the company and engineering team.
Visiting other FM Global locations (such as the Corporate offices and research campus).
Participating in professional development events with other interns.

Qualifications

Successful Consultant Engineer Interns have the following qualifications:
Plan to graduate with a bachelors degree in engineering (civil, chemical, mechanical, electrical, etc.) or fire protection;
Ability to work F/T during summer internship;
Strong verbal and written communications skills;
Good analytical, organizational, problem solving, and interpersonal skills;
Efficient time management skills;
Naturally inquisitive with the ability to undertake and deliver projects with minimal supervision;
Solid technical aptitude including diverse knowledge of engineering principles;
Valid driver’s license and access to a vehicle throughout internship;
Ability to commute to Parsippany, New Jersey throughout internship;
Physical ability to climb ladders, lift >25 lbs., balance, and work at elevated heights;
Proficient in MS Office products.

You will be expected to work independently.

title: CariClub Internship - Rotational
requirements:
The Company

Developing and retaining high potential employees is the top priority for C-level executives worldwide. CariClub partners with industry-leading firms like Morgan Stanley, Deloitte, Davis Polk, and Apollo to place their employees on non-profit boards through our proprietary matching platform. Our corporate clients know that the professional and leadership skills learned during non-profit board service are exactly the ones companies struggle to cultivate through traditional leadership training programs. At CariClub, we are on a mission to develop the next generation of inclusive leaders in the corporate and philanthropic world by empowering our community of ambitious young professionals to become a driving force for good.

We currently have 25+ top-tier clients across finance, law and consulting including Citigroup, Morgan Stanley, Davis Polk, Apollo, Deloitte, Blackstone, Unilever and more. Our platform hosts 1,000+ nonprofits and 1,000+ young professional members and we are currently active in 5 cities across the United States with plans to scale nationally.

Check out our promo video here.

The Opportunity

As a CariClub Intern, you'll be working directly with one of our managers (Business Development, Nonprofit Engagement, Member Engagement, or Operations). At the most basic level, your job will be to understand business concepts and work across every function of the company while improving processes and working on projects that match your interest and skill set. We're looking for highly motivated, sharp and detail-oriented interns who are passionate about problem solving, process improvement, and harnessing technology for good. An ideal candidate has prior internship experience and has strong research and analytical skills. We want you to be extremely detail-oriented, ask thoughtful questions, and proactively bring suggestions to the table.

What you'll be doing
Business development/sales
Community engagement
Nonprofit engagement
Finance and operations
UI/UX design
Software development
Research and analysis
Strategy and ad-hoc projects for the CEO
What you're like
A self-starter, you enjoy taking initiative and seeing a project through from start to finish
You love to learn and are insatiably curious
You do not need to be hand-held. We can give you a project, without a ton of structure and you can create a structured response and find innovative ways to get the requisite information
You thrive in fast-paced environments where workloads are changing and require you to actively clarify needs and prioritize your time accordingly
You have the mentality of doing whatever is necessary to get the job done
You value working on a diverse team with varying skill sets and backgrounds
You are constantly focused on the user and his/her experience, whoever they may be
You have an entrepreneurial spirit (you like to get shit done)
You have emotional resilience, are consistent and growth-oriented
You are passionate about CariClub’s mission
You embraces challenges and are not daunted by large projects
Internship details
Part-time (~15 hours/week)
Preferred February - April (dates are flexible)
Remote internship, we're technically based in NYC (Soho) and are excited to get back, but will remain remote for the foreseeable future
If you're interested in learning more, please reach out - we'd love to chat!

CariClub Press

The Wall Street Journal: Nonprofits Turn to Matchmakers to Fill Their Boards

Crain's: A former trader connects young professionals to charitable boards

Forbes: Meet The Startup Helping Employees Join Non-Profit Junior Boards At Companies Like Citigroup And KKR

Bloomberg: Why Elite Law Firms are Circling This Little Start-Up

Fast Company: Want to give back by being on a nonprofit board? This site will help

Entrepreneur: A 'Holiday' Thought: Philanthropic Involvement Can Advance your Career. Here's How.

Compensation

Compensation is commensurate with the position’s requirements and the applicant's experience (full-time roles only). In a performance-based environment, this will include a base salary and a possible stakeholder position in the Company.

CariClub is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate against qualified applicants or employees on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual preference, sexual identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, military status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law, rule, or regulation.

title: 2021 ASCEND Summer Leadership Program + 2022 Winter/Summer Tax Internship (Boise)
requirements:
Are you looking to begin a successful and meaningful career in public accounting? If so, Armanino’s Summer Leadership Program, ASCEND, is the perfect place to get started!

Please Note
This opportunity is available for our Boise office location
You will be considered for both the ASCEND and 2022 internship in the same interview process.
The 2021 ASCEND Summer Leadership Program will be held virtually.

What You’ll Experience

We’re excited to introduce the new ASCEND program, which is a week-long program that will highlight our firm culture and provide you with the opportunity to explore various service lines, learn more about our Internal Mobility program, and discuss trends with some of Armanino’s most innovative practitioners. The main focus of our ASCEND program will be service line case studies where you will receive hands-on experience doing work that our professionals do on a daily basis. You will have the opportunity to participate in any of the case studies for Audit, Consulting, Risk Assurance & Advisory Service (RAAS), and Tax.

When you you submit your application, it will be for the 2021 ASCEND Summer Leadership Program + 2022 Winter/Summer Tax Internship. At the conclusion of ASCEND, you will confirm that your desired service line is Tax (or you can let us know if you would like to intern in another service line) and you will confirm your internship season (winter or summer 2022).

During your 2022 internship, you will gain hands-on experience working alongside professionals at all levels (associate to partner), who will provide insight into the field of public accounting. In the first week of the internship, you'll experience New Employee Orientation (NEO), service line-specific training, and introductions to your mentor team (intern Buddy and Performance Coach). Selected Fridays of your internship, you will get together with your intern group to participate in cross-functional or professional development training, followed by a social event with colleagues.

Your internship will provide you with the same exposure to Armanino as our associate level hires, while participating in interactive and engaging programming!

What You’ll Do
Prepare Corporate, Partnership, Trust and Individual tax returns on behalf of clients
Research changes in tax regulation and develop tax planning skills
Work as an individual contributor and as part of a team to support client engagements
Work with a team of 2-4 professionals on client projects (staff, senior, manager and partner)
Develop an understanding of and capability in accounting, financial and database software
Develop administrative, professional and interpersonal skills to the extent of being able to organize, analyze and communicate with others in a productive and efficient manner

What You’ll Need
Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master’s program in business with an emphasis in accounting or taxation
Final graduation date/CPA eligibility date (whichever comes later) between December 2022 and August 2023 strongly preferred
Minimum 3.0 GPA preferred
Basic knowledge of accounting principles
Experience with Microsoft Suite (i.e. Word, Excel, Power Point)

title: Marketing Intern
requirements:
Requisition ID: req13988

Job Title: Marketing Intern

Sector: Marketing

Employment Category: Intern

Employment Type: Part-Time

Open to Expatriates: No

Location: Salt Lake City, UT USA

Job Description

The International Rescue Committee in Salt Lake City assists refugee entrepreneurs in all stages of business creation and management. The small business program includes technical assistance, access to market opportunities, access to start-up capital, and other business consulting.

SCOPE OF INTERN WORK: This intern assists in providing new and existing businesses with guidance in marketing and business outreach. This may include logo creation, posts to social media platforms such as Facebook or Instagram, the creation of mailing lists, and other business outreach. Additionally, this intern will be responsible for consulting on brand creation, development, and growth. This intern will be responsible for direct assistance in responding to client needs through emails and other assistance requests. This position also requires the maintenance and responses to ongoing small business marketing needs. Additionally, this intern will grow the packaged services offered to small businesses. This may include the creation of a curriculum that will result in business owner's ability to independently maintain their business marketing needs and assistance with workshop creation or teaching. The ultimate goal of this internship will be to increase business for refugee entrepreneurs and expand the marketing and branding services offered to them.

COMMITMENT: 3 to 4 months starting in May 2021, 15 hours per week

Responsibilities

Qualifications
Assist with all marketing needs for refugee business owners. This includes social mediamarketing, webpage creation and enhancement, and other business outreach.
Strengthening entrepreneur’s brands and branded materials, including but not limited to logos, market and festival materials, and customization of digital presence.
Expanding refugee business owner’s market reach and increasing the small business profits
Enabling small business owners to take control of their business outreach by teaching andcoaching on how to create engaging posts and branded materials.
Create and enhance culturally and linguistically appropriate guides to facilitate teachingentrepreneurs these processes, including estimated costs and technical know-how.
Work with economic development/small business staff to complete additional business andoperational tasks as needed
Learning Objectives
The intern will gain professional experience in business marketing and resource development.
The intern will gain experience and deepen understanding of working and communicating with diverse populations including English language learners and refugees.
The intern will learn various methods and technology used to track, report, and disseminate business-related data and information.
Requirements
High school graduate and currently enrollment in/recent graduate of a 4-yearaccredited institution. Applicants should have completed at least one semester of relevant business or marketing coursework, or can prove competency through previous work experience.
Culturally competent individual committed to working with vulnerable communities. Professionalism and respect when working with clients is essential at all times.
Previous experience in business development, marketing, database management, andoutreach or office assistant/administration required. Previous direct experience inmarketing or small business development is preferred.
High level of tech competency is required. This intern will need the ability to respond to client and staff emails quickly, schedule and execute virtual meetings, manage data online, and produce online marketing materials.
Excellent interpersonal skills, with ability to initiate and develop relationships with contacts in the community.
Ideally suited for a candidate who is interested in working with small businesses
This position will be done virtually until further notice – access to a computer and internet is required. Ability to work from the Salt Lake City area is preferred but not required.

This is an unpaid internship position. No financial compensation, including compensation for relocation, is available.

title: IT Consulting Intern- Summer 2021, St. Louis, MO
requirements:
Position Summary

This is an internship for individuals who are interested in pursuing a career in professional services, specifically in the field of Information Technology (IT) Audit and Cybersecurity Consulting. The IT Consulting intern will focus on developing communication and writing skills, building their technical skill base, understanding and executing diligent client service, and becoming oriented to the Firm's practices, policies, and culture. Work is performed under close supervision. Responsibilities increase with demonstrated skill.

The Technology Risk and Compliance (TRC) major service offerings include IT Audit, SOC 1, SOC 2, PCI, HIPAA, Privacy and cybersecurity initiatives. In addition, TRC supports financial statement audit teams and internal audit teams with documenting and testing IT controls.

Tasks

Key Responsibilities
IT Audit engagements: Basic audit acumen is needed, including the ability to grasp concepts quickly and demonstrate knowledge of basic technical skills, as well as related knowledge of common systems and procedures.
Communication skills: Candidate needs strong technical and business communication skills.
Ability and willingness to learn general IT audit skills: Much of what IT consultants learn is through on the job training, IT consultants must be open to “learn by doing” in the fast-paced environment of IT consulting
Decision making: IT consultants are expected to make well-thought-out decisions and consider all facts prior to making final conclusions.
Regulatory standards: IT consultants are expected to follow regulations and professional ethics standards bodies, such as the AICPA.
Time keeping: Consultants are expected to track time and maintain designated chargeable hours for the year.
Quality control: Consultants are expected to ensure quality control procedures are being executed under direction of engagement supervisor, and perform thorough self-review of all work prior to submission.

Skills
Computer Skills: Ability to operate spreadsheet, word processing and email programs
Speaking: Talking to others to convey information effectively
Active Listening: Giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.
Writing: Communicating effectively in writing as appropriate for the needs of the audience.
Reading Comprehension - Understanding written sentences and paragraphs in work related documents.
Social Perceptiveness: Being aware of others' reactions and understanding why they react as they do.

Experience And Education
Pursing a Bachelors in Accounting with an interest in IT Audit or a degree in CS/MIS
Demonstrate knowledge of basic business, technology, and audit principles/standards

Must have a desire to work toward achieving one or more of the following in the future:
Certified Public Accountant (CPA)
Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA): ISACA's globally recognized cornerstone certification for IS, audit, control, assurance, and security professionals who control, monitor, and assess an organization's information technology and business systems. This is considered the current industry standard for IT auditors.
Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP): An independent information security certification governed by the International Information Systems Security Certification Consortium, also known as ISC², which provides security training to information assets.
Certified Information Security Manager (CISM): ISACA's certification program for those who manage, design, oversee, or assess an enterprise's information security.

Evolve the planning and execution of marketing, strategic partner and business development strategies with guidance from the CEO
Lead the setup, execution and optimization of marketing, digital and social media and infrastructure and engagement campaigns based on data and insights
Research and develop POV's for target domains, industries, sectors, companies and their leaders; contribute to content development and thought leadership for outreach and engagement campaigns to drive lead generation and new business development
Evolve and enhance pitch decks, proposals and processes for projects and engagements, including scope review
Collaborate with our UX and design teams to create cross-platform marketing assets (digital, social) that bring our brand, POV's and content to life in creative ways

Frame research, identify and synthesize relevant business issues and trends into new opportunity spaces for Vee
Develop business models that create new opportunities for products and services, and new revenue streams across time horizons
Leverage financial modeling to quantify size of prize; TAM/SAM/SOM; and determine viability to help assess investments in new products and services

Currently enrolled in an MBA program with a concentration in Marketing, Management and any other related; Finance or Entrepreneurship a plus

title: Research Intern with GIS Experience
requirements:
Apply Here

https://workforcenow.adp.com/mascsr/default/mdf/recruitment/recruitment.html?cid=5dd5fada-13a4-4908-9840-3384319f763b&ccId=19000101_000001&type=MP&lang=en_US&selectedMenuKey=CurrentOpenings

Research Intern With GIS Experience

Marstel-Day, LLC, an Environmental Consulting and Planning firm, is seeking a highly motivated Research Intern with a strong commitment to a conservation ethic, a strong desire to identify and support strategies for natural resource conservation, and a commitment to use "green” best management practices in the performance of their work in the Company's Fredericksburg, VA office on a variety of projects, primarily in support of the company's environmental and natural resource, and sustainability initiatives.

Marstel-Day is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, and women and people of color are encouraged to apply for this position.

Work Location

Candidates should be in the Virginia/MD/DC area and be able to easily travel to work at the company's principal office in Fredericksburg, VA. Work is to be performed remotely until COVID-19 restrictions are lifted, but occasional travel, including airline travel, to current and future project sites is required.

Duties

The primary duties of the Intern will be to provide GIS, research, and technical writing support for the execution of Environmental Planning, Sustainability, and Natural and Cultural Resource projects for federal agencies, state/local governments. or private entities. The selected intern(s) will gather and analyze data, prepare GIS products, and develop written and graphic reports. GIS tasks may include data mining and data organization, spatial analysis, and creation of visualizations and reports for delivery to clients. Research Interns may be selected to deliver presentations to the company's partners, employees, consultants or clients.

Essential Functions Description

The incumbent will normally work in an indoor, climate-controlled work station or office, but be frequently required to travel to various other sites and/or offices which may not be climate controlled; to manage and coordinate work by scheduling and undertaking airline, train or vehicle travel. Incumbent will be required to organize and coordinate schedules, analyze and interpret data, and engage in fast-moving problem solving; communicate quickly and precisely with coworkers and clients, craft written communication including the use of e-mail and other electronic reproduction of words, graphs, and photos. Incumbent will be required to make regular use of and be proficient with computers, telephones, mobile communication devices, copy machines and printers.

Salary And Hours And Benefits

The Research Internship will be a will be a full- or part-time position for a fixed period. Compensation for a fulltime position (40 hours per week) will be a fixed stipend of $2,600 per month with the hourly rate equivalent being $15.00/hr. Performance of weekly hours will be flexible to accommodate class schedules. The company will consider internships of fewer than 40 hours per week depending on the selected candidate's skills, availability and the available workload, for which the amount of the stipend would be adjusted proportionately. The position is considered a "non-exempt” position under the Fair Labor Standards Act and any overtime on a weekly basis (or daily basis where required) would be paid beyond the stipend.

Application Requirements

If reading this open position announcement on our Company's website employment page, follow the instructions provided on the employment page. If viewing this announcement on another independent employment web site, there may be additional site requirements that are necessary for submittal of an application. If reading this announcement offline or on a site that does not link to our webpage, go to https://www.marstel-day.com/marstel-day-employment/. Attach a cover letter, your resume, your most current college transcripts, the names and contact information for a minimum of 3 professional references, a brief writing sample (of 4-8 pages) and a file that includes a minimum of 3 GIS samples (of 1-5 pages) with associated text. Submittals that do not include all the requested items will not be considered complete. Applications are accepted only through the company website. Please follow all instructions and directions provided on the Company's employment page.

Required Skills

Orientation, education, experience, training

In addition to possessing a strong conservation ethic, strong Research intern must exhibit well-developed research, writing and editing skills. Ideal Research intern would also possess strong skills in preparation and delivery of Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel products.

Qualifications
Possess a strong commitment to a conservation ethic, a strong desire to identify and support strategies for natural resource conservation and community planning, and a commitment to use green best management practices in the performance of work;
Be pursuing, or have recently graduated with, a BS/BA in GIS, Computer Science, Geography, Planning, Environmental Science or other related disciplines. Having a GPA of 3.4 or better is a significant plus;
Have a minimum of one year of applicable GIS training (i.e., completion of at least three semester-length GIS courses). Possessing a GIS certificate is a plus;
Have worked with current versions of ESRI ArcGIS Desktop and/or ArcGIS Pro for a minimum of one year;
Possess familiarity with both raster & vector GIS files;
Have strong ability to create compelling visualizations that demonstrate effective cartographic techniques and an understanding of focal themes;
Possess considerable knowledge of the following: Geodatabase usage and creation; locating, classifying, organizing, and analyzing data; use of satellite and ortho-imagery, and effective labeling techniques;
Be able to create and edit feature classes including spatial topology and attribute tables;
Possess or show demonstrated interest in knowledge of Python or other GIS related scripting language;
Have strong analytical, oral, and written communication skills;
Have the demonstrated ability to work independently and in teams;
Possess strong attention-to-detail initiative and self-motivation; and
Have strong organizational skills.


The Incumbent Must
Be eligible to work in the United States (a Client Form I-9 must be completed by the selected candidate and will be submitted to the U.S. Department of Homeland Security for verification of eligibility to work through E-Verify).
Submit to and pass a company criminal background check, if selected for the position. This is an ongoing contingency even after being hired.
Currently live in, or be willing to relocate to, a designated HUBZone census tract (see www.sba.gov/hubzone/ for more information) (a relocation allowance may be considered).

Equal Employment Opportunity Policy and Affirmative Action Employer

Marstel-Day is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating and sustaining a diverse and collaborative workplace. Marstel-Day provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, military status, or status as a Vietnam-era or special disabled veteran in accordance with applicable federal and state laws. In addition, the Company complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the Company has facilities or places its employees for assignment. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfers, leave of absence, compensation, and training.

Military Friendly Employer

Marstel-Day is a certified Virginia Values Veterans (V3) employer. We respect and value the service of our veterans and their families. Marstel-Day is committed to hiring transitioning service members, veterans, and military spouses. We have a growing internal network of veterans and their family members, supported by proactive recruitment and career development.

title: Social Media Intern
requirements:
Organization Summary

Lindsay Corporation (NYSE: LNN) is a leading global manufacturer and distributor of irrigation and infrastructure equipment and technology. Established in 1955, the company has been at the forefront of research and development of innovative solutions to meet the food, fuel, fiber and transportation needs of the world’s rapidly growing population. The Lindsay family of irrigation brands includes Zimmatic® center pivot and lateral move agricultural irrigation systems and FieldNET® remote irrigation management and scheduling technology as well as irrigation consulting and design and industrial IoT solutions. Also a global leader in the transportation industry, Lindsay Transportation Solutions manufactures equipment to improve road safety and keep traffic moving on the world’s roads, bridges and tunnels, through the Barrier Systems®, Road Zipper® and Snoline™ brands. For more information about Lindsay Corporation, visit www.Lindsay.com.

Position Description

Lindsay Corporation is hiring a Social Media Intern. This role will be responsible for supporting Lindsay’s social media content and channel management, with a focus on corporate and irrigation segment channels. This role will also include support for other marketing functions, such as marketing research and content development for Lindsay’s website and intranet. The ideal candidate will be proactive, extremely detail oriented, have a passion for communicating, able to translate business and marketing objectives into day-to-day action, and have a continuous improvement mindset.

Position Details

This short-term, hourly internship will be based at Lindsay’s corporate headquarters in Omaha, Nebraska, which may include partial remote work in accordance with Lindsay’s COVID-19 safety policies. Travel is unlikely but possible, though isn’t a requirement for the role. As an hourly position, employer benefits are not offered. An internship may lead to a full-time permanent opportunity, but is not a guarantee of permanent placement within the company.

Duties & Responsibilities
Monitor assigned social media channels daily to identify reactive and proactive engagement opportunities, and respond to follower comments/questions/direct messages
Assist with design and execution of social media content and campaigns
Work closely across departments to manage customer and follower inquiries as appropriate
Build, manage and implement social media content calendar for assigned channels
Collect and develop content ideas for assigned channels, including working across the business to mine for stories
Ensure adherence to Lindsay’s global social media strategy while representing the voice of Lindsay and driving growth of channel followers and engagement
Monitor and analyze key performance indicators to evaluate overall channel performance
Identify insights and opportunities for improvement and to inform future content, campaigns and engagement opportunities

Preferred Qualifications
Technical, working knowledge of Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter and Instagram for business
Familiarity with social media marketing concepts and tactics
Excellent written communication skills, including writing for business and writing for social media
Experience with content management systems and standard business communication programs, such as Microsoft Office
Experience and ability to grow proficiency with social media and web analytics tools such as Facebook Insights and Google Analytics
Experience with image/video editing software preferred but not required
Interest in social media marketing trends

Physical Requirements
Requires ability to work remotely with reliable internet connection for conducting job duties and team phone and video conferencing
May require some time on site at Lindsay’s offices in Omaha (with adherence to current safety protocols)

title: Strategic Initiatives Consulting - Master's Internship
requirements:
Description

Description of your department’s function:

TPMG Administration oversees the smooth operation of the outpatient clinics. It ensures effective management of employees, developing and implementing policies, training employees, and more. Within TPMG Administration, the Strategies Initiatives team is made of project managers and consultants who provide project management, consulting and analytic support, and large scale strategic implementation. The Strategic Initiatives team assists leadership in carrying out projects of strategic importance to the medical center.

Describe the project(s) that the intern will be responsible for completing during the internship:

This role will provide project management and consulting support to medical center operations and programmatic strategic initiatives, as well as build our culture of Performance Improvement around quality and care experience metrics. The intern will provide project management and consulting support for a selection of projects, such as new clinical service implementation, or local or regional initiatives in key functional areas (care experience/service, wellness, diversity, IT projects, and others). Previous projects that interns have worked on include: partnering with KP SF OB/GYN Leadership and Regional Ventures to execute on a detailed project plan to open a new IVF Center in San Francisco; working with Psychiatry and Pediatrics department to launch outpatient program to address eating disorders in teens; providing strategic support to redesign clinic workflows; using change management and performance improvement to analyze and improve schedule creation; and providing project management to expand our patient advisory councils.

List specific skills you are looking for in an intern:

The preferred qualities include willingness to collaborate, good communicator, good interpersonal skills, organized, and fast learner. Experience analyzing data, creating process flowcharts, providing project support, performance improvement, human centered design, and team facilitation preferred.

Provides high quality and cost effective project management, consulting, and analytic support. Assists senior consultants, clients, and/or groups in identifying and resolving issues of strategic importance to the organization. May assist senior consultants or manage complex projects independently.

Essential Functions
Defines and frames complex issues and develops time tables/processes for decision making.
Translates needs, issues, and ideas into effective strategies and action plans.
Coordinates team/project activities and schedules.
Researches key business issues, and directs the collecting and analyzing of quantitative and qualitative data.
Synthesizes analysis and identifies key findings.
Assists in the determination of goals and priorities with team, clients, or project management sponsors.
Establishes team membership and project participants.
Develops proposals for clients outlining proposed project structure, approach and work plan.
Provides staff leadership to project teams, as well as manages work of outside consultants when needed.
Formulates specific implementation plans and evaluates the effectiveness of actions/programs implemented.
Communicates results/recommendations to project sponsors.
Develops creative alternative solutions.
Recommends action steps to team and client.
Plans and facilitates meetings.
Makes formal presentations to various senior level audiences.
Transfers project team knowledge/tools to client.
Participates in the development and management of the department, including coaching, recruiting, conducting performance reviews for analysts, and other departmental activities.
Experience

Basic Qualifications:
Minimum four (4) years of related analytical and/or consulting experience required.
Education
Bachelor's degree in business administration, economics, health care administration, operations research, public health administration, or other related field, OR four (4) years of experience in a directly related field.
High School Diploma or General Education Development (GED) required.
License, Certification, Registration
N/A.
Additional Requirements
Specific technical expertise required as specified.
Demonstrated ability to conduct and interpret quantitative/qualitative analysis.
Must demonstrate effective communication, consulting, interpersonal, presentation, and project management skills.
Must be able to work in a Labor/Management Partnership environment.
Preferred Qualifications
Master's degree preferred.
