title: Corporate Strategy Intern
requirements:
Corporate Strategy Intern

Corporate Development and Strategy Team | Chegg
Remote, United States

Your goal - to improve the education process and better the lives of students -- by interning in Chegg’s Corporate Development and Strategy group.

Organization: Corporate Development and Strategy

The Corporate Development and Strategy team is an integral part of Chegg - We work closely with the C-team to develop and execute the company’s overall strategy. Execution of strategy includes making decisions around whether the company should buy, build or partner, and therefore is closely tied to the Corporate Development function. Our small team is comprised of analysts, strategists, thought leaders, relationship builders, and dealmakers. The team drives to an understanding of relevant markets, builds out the landscape, sources deals, negotiates and closes transactions, and then develops and manages the integration plan. We also conduct market and competitive research into education trends and areas of future opportunity.

Role: Corporate Development and Strategy Intern

We’re looking for a highly motivated intern to help our team work on strategic projects in concert with the company’s business and product leaders. You will conduct research in support of our strategic roadmap and work across a number of business units, including Learning Services, Skills, and Life. The right candidate will be a self-starter with strong organizational skills and have the ability to think critically about industry and company trends.

Responsibilities
Research EdTech trends to help determine areas of opportunity and further develop our thesis on the education market and its competitive landscape
Analyze other education companies and make assessments regarding their potential as partners, competitors, investment candidates, or acquisition opportunities
Support strategic initiatives such as international expansion, product and audience expansion, partnerships, and investment opportunities
Partner with business and product leaders to develop business cases
Present key findings and recommendations to executives

Requirements
A rising sophomore or junior currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in business, finance, economics, or a related field from an accredited four-year college or university
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder).
Have the ability to work for a continuous 12 weeks in the summer
Have the ability to work 40 hours per week
Strong analytical and communication skills
Advanced knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)
Self-motivated; independent, organized and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple teams; interest in Chegg’s mission
Ability to think critically and work autonomously in both well-defined and ambiguous project environments

Nice To Have
Experience with market research and business analysis
Demonstrated passion for education and technology
Project or internship experience in investment banking, private equity, venture capital, or consulting
Project or internship experience in the education industry
What project will the intern work on?

The strategy intern will support a variety of initiatives, including contributing to the strategic planning of Chegg’s expansion into new international markets for our Learning Services and Skills business units and new non-academic verticals related to our Life business unit. Through primary and secondary research, the intern will develop an understanding of our focus markets, map the competitive landscape in each of these markets, and meaningfully shape Chegg’s entry strategy in these markets. Through their support of these initiatives, the intern will work closely with the Strategy & Corporate development team, as well as cross-functionally with a variety of Chegg’s business units.

What skills will the intern gain?
Advanced Excel
Market research
Business analysis
Basic accounting

See what it’s like to be a Chegg intern!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cp1m_ZtOT_4

Learn more about Chegg!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YYHnkwiD7Oo

About Chegg

Chegg puts students first. As the leading connected learning platform, the company makes higher education more affordable, more accessible, and more successful for students. Chegg is a publicly-held company based in Santa Clara, California, and trades on the NYSE under the symbol CHGG. For more information, visit www.chegg.com.

Chegg is an equal opportunity employer

United States Remote: This is a remote position which may be performed anywhere in the United States except for within the state of Colorado.

#LI- MI

title: University of Arizona 2021 Campus Summer Intern
requirements:
Ankura is a team of excellence founded on innovation and growth.

University of Arizona 2021 Campus Summer Intern

About Ankura: Ankura is an expert services firm defined by HOW we solve challenges. Whether a client is facing an immediate business challenge, trying to increase the value of their company or protect against future risks, Ankura designs, develops, and executes tailored solutions by assembling the right combination of expertise. We build on this experience with every case, client, and situation, collaborating to create innovative, customized solutions, and strategies designed for today’s ever-changing business environment. This gives our clients unparalleled insight and experience across a wide range of economic, governance, and regulatory challenges. At Ankura, we know that collaboration drives results.

Position: Ankura Summer Intern

Description: The Summer Internship Program has been created to give students an opportunity to learn what life as a consultant is like at Ankura. As an Intern, you will work on a variety of projects with different engagement teams. The program aims to give you exposure to the breadth of our services and client work. You will work closely with our professionals – Consultants through Director – and gain first-hand experience in consulting.

Business Groups
Construction, Disputes & Advisory: As a Construction Intern, you will develop analytical skills while being immersed in the world of client services. Construction Interns work directly with project team leaders and experts, assisting our experts in performing the detailed analyses required to provide the best solutions for our clients. Interns perform project schedule, cost, productivity, and statistical analyses as well as assist with review of key project issues through document review and database creation/management.
Data & Technology: Interns will be engaged on a variety of projects, internal initiatives, training opportunities and technical challenges, office-wide intern projects, and various social events. The internship program is focused on providing interns with the opportunity to learn about Ankura and the industry, learn and utilize new skills, and develop relationships. Interns will have the opportunity to learn, use, or gain exposure to a wide variety of programs, platforms, and programming languages, including SQL, Python, C#, VBA, and Tableau.
Disputes & Economics: Intern assignments will involve work in fact-finding, allocating costs, analyzing damages, organizing information, or helping to manage data. You will also learn new skills and participate in social and volunteer activities throughout the summer.
Risk, Forensics & Compliance: An ideal intern candidate should have an interest in forensic accounting, investigations, litigation consulting, as well as other related areas described above. Responsibilities will include applying technical accounting, forensic accounting, and analytical skills to various client situations. As an intern, Ankura will provide the opportunity to experience a variety of projects working collaboratively on small, diverse teams with skilled, intelligent, driven, and successful individuals.
Turnaround & Restructuring: T&R is an exciting, fast-paced environment in which our professionals’ partner with clients to address critical issues including over-levered balance sheets, liquidity constraints, unprofitable business units, and adverse industry conditions. Clients rely on Ankura professionals to solve complex challenges with the expectation that they will quickly assess the situation, develop a strategic plan, and effectively execute the turnaround. Our Summer Interns will be an integral part of our project teams.
Qualifications: Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Business Analytics, MIS, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or another analytical area of study; analytical problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset; ability to utilize technology to solve complex problems

Ankura is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment where mutual respect and collaboration is paramount. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, protected veteran status, national origin, or any other legally protected status.

title: Intern - Digital Marketing - Campus 2021
requirements:
Overview

Guidehouse is a leading management consulting firm serving the public and commercial markets. We guide our clients forward towards new futures that build trust in society and your professional skills along the journey. Join us at Guidehouse.

Responsibilities

Guidehouse is looking for a Digital Marketing Intern to perform various tasks and support our internal marketing operations. This position will support the Digital and Brand Experience team create, maintain, and edit all the different assets that are used for digital marketing campaigns.

Throughout the internship, you will have the chance to work with our internal teams on assigned projects, meet with upper management to reflect on your personal and professional development, and socialize with your fellow interns during outings/activities.

As An Intern, You Will
Help maintain our different web platforms via our Content Management System, including but not limited to: Replacing collateral, editing copy, creating new pages, adding images to the media library and resizing photos
Keep our Brand Asset Management tool up to date to ensure we have the latest information and brand approved imager
Update our collateral material to include the latest boilerplate information and contact info, and upload them into our CMS tool

Required

Qualifications
Minimum Years of Experience: 0 years
Minimum Degree Status Required: Graduating with an undergraduate or higher level degree between December 2021 and July 2022 in a related discipline
Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite

Desired
1+ year of experience in the digital world
Highly conceptual with amazing visual aesthetic.
Passion for emerging digital marketing trends.
Experience designing email templates in HTML
Experience using a Content Management System (i.e. Sitecore)

Additional Requirements

The successful candidate must not be subject to employment restrictions from a former employer (such as a non-compete) that would prevent the candidate from performing the job responsibilities as described.

This position will be active for less than 3 months

Disclaimer

Guidehouse will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law or ordinance including the Fair Chance Ordinance of Los Angeles and San Francisco.

Guidehouse does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Guidehouse and Guidehouse will not be obligated to pay a placement fee.

Personal and Family Sick Time & Company Paid Holidays

401(k) Retirement Plan

The right candidate will be a self-starter with strong organizational skills and have the ability to think critically about industry and company trends.

Responsibilities
Research EdTech trends to help determine areas of opportunity and further develop our thesis on the education market and its competitive landscape
Analyze other education companies and make assessments regarding their potential as partners, competitors, investment candidates, or acquisition opportunities
Support strategic initiatives such as international expansion, product and audience expansion, partnerships, and investment opportunities
Partner with business and product leaders to develop business cases
Present key findings and recommendations to executives

Requirements
A rising sophomore or junior currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in business, finance, economics, or a related field from an accredited four-year college or university
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder).
Have the ability to work for a continuous 12 weeks in the summer
Have the ability to work 40 hours per week
Strong analytical and communication skills
Advanced knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)
Self-motivated; independent, organized and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple teams; interest in Chegg’s mission
Ability to think critically and work autonomously in both well-defined and ambiguous project environments

Nice To Have
Experience with market research and business analysis
Demonstrated passion for education and technology
Project or internship experience in investment banking, private equity, venture capital, or consulting
Project or internship experience in the education industry
What project will the intern work on?

The strategy intern will support a variety of initiatives, including contributing to the strategic planning of Chegg’s expansion into new international markets for our Learning Services and Skills business units and new non-academic verticals related to our Life business unit. Through primary and secondary research, the intern will develop an understanding of our focus markets, map the competitive landscape in each of these markets, and meaningfully shape Chegg’s entry strategy in these markets. Through their support of these initiatives, the intern will work closely with the Strategy & Corporate development team, as well as cross-functionally with a variety of Chegg’s business units.

What skills will the intern gain?
Advanced Excel
Market research
Business analysis
Basic accounting

#LI- MI

title: University of California Los Angeles 2021 Campus Summer Intern
requirements:
Ankura is a team of excellence founded on innovation and growth.

About Ankura: Ankura is an expert services firm defined by HOW we solve challenges. Whether a client is facing an immediate business challenge, trying to increase the value of their company or protect against future risks, Ankura designs, develops, and executes tailored solutions by assembling the right combination of expertise. We build on this experience with every case, client, and situation, collaborating to create innovative, customized solutions, and strategies designed for today’s ever-changing business environment. This gives our clients unparalleled insight and experience across a wide range of economic, governance, and regulatory challenges. At Ankura, we know that collaboration drives results.

Position: Ankura Summer Intern

Description: The Summer Internship Program has been created to give students an opportunity to learn what life as a consultant is like at Ankura. As an Intern, you will work on a variety of projects with different engagement teams. The program aims to give you exposure to the breadth of our services and client work. You will work closely with our professionals – Consultants through Director – and gain first-hand experience in consulting.

Business Groups
Construction, Disputes & Advisory: As a Construction Intern, you will develop analytical skills while being immersed in the world of client services. Construction Interns work directly with project team leaders and experts, assisting our experts in performing the detailed analyses required to provide the best solutions for our clients. Interns perform project schedule, cost, productivity, and statistical analyses as well as assist with review of key project issues through document review and database creation/management.
Data & Technology: Interns will be engaged on a variety of projects, internal initiatives, training opportunities and technical challenges, office-wide intern projects, and various social events. The internship program is focused on providing interns with the opportunity to learn about Ankura and the industry, learn and utilize new skills, and develop relationships. Interns will have the opportunity to learn, use, or gain exposure to a wide variety of programs, platforms, and programming languages, including SQL, Python, C#, VBA, and Tableau.
Disputes & Economics: Intern assignments will involve work in fact-finding, allocating costs, analyzing damages, organizing information, or helping to manage data. You will also learn new skills and participate in social and volunteer activities throughout the summer.
Risk, Forensics & Compliance: An ideal intern candidate should have an interest in forensic accounting, investigations, litigation consulting, as well as other related areas described above. Responsibilities will include applying technical accounting, forensic accounting, and analytical skills to various client situations. As an intern, Ankura will provide the opportunity to experience a variety of projects working collaboratively on small, diverse teams with skilled, intelligent, driven, and successful individuals.
Turnaround & Restructuring: T&R is an exciting, fast-paced environment in which our professionals’ partner with clients to address critical issues including over-levered balance sheets, liquidity constraints, unprofitable business units, and adverse industry conditions. Clients rely on Ankura professionals to solve complex challenges with the expectation that they will quickly assess the situation, develop a strategic plan, and effectively execute the turnaround. Our Summer Interns will be an integral part of our project teams.
Qualifications: Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Business Analytics, MIS, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or another analytical area of study; analytical problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset; ability to utilize technology to solve complex problems

Ankura is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment where mutual respect and collaboration is paramount. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, protected veteran status, national origin, or any other legally protected status.

title: Wake Forest University 2021 Campus Summer Intern
requirements:
Ankura is a team of excellence founded on innovation and growth.

About Ankura: Ankura is an expert services firm defined by HOW we solve challenges. Whether a client is facing an immediate business challenge, trying to increase the value of their company or protect against future risks, Ankura designs, develops, and executes tailored solutions by assembling the right combination of expertise. We build on this experience with every case, client, and situation, collaborating to create innovative, customized solutions, and strategies designed for today’s ever-changing business environment. This gives our clients unparalleled insight and experience across a wide range of economic, governance, and regulatory challenges. At Ankura, we know that collaboration drives results.

Position: Ankura Summer Intern

Description: The Summer Internship Program has been created to give students an opportunity to learn what life as a consultant is like at Ankura. As an Intern, you will work on a variety of projects with different engagement teams. The program aims to give you exposure to the breadth of our services and client work. You will work closely with our professionals – Consultants through Director – and gain first-hand experience in consulting.

Business Groups
Construction, Disputes & Advisory: As a Construction Intern, you will develop analytical skills while being immersed in the world of client services. Construction Interns work directly with project team leaders and experts, assisting our experts in performing the detailed analyses required to provide the best solutions for our clients. Interns perform project schedule, cost, productivity, and statistical analyses as well as assist with review of key project issues through document review and database creation/management.
Data & Technology: Interns will be engaged on a variety of projects, internal initiatives, training opportunities and technical challenges, office-wide intern projects, and various social events. The internship program is focused on providing interns with the opportunity to learn about Ankura and the industry, learn and utilize new skills, and develop relationships. Interns will have the opportunity to learn, use, or gain exposure to a wide variety of programs, platforms, and programming languages, including SQL, Python, C#, VBA, and Tableau.
Disputes & Economics: Intern assignments will involve work in fact-finding, allocating costs, analyzing damages, organizing information, or helping to manage data. You will also learn new skills and participate in social and volunteer activities throughout the summer.
Risk, Forensics & Compliance: An ideal intern candidate should have an interest in forensic accounting, investigations, litigation consulting, as well as other related areas described above. Responsibilities will include applying technical accounting, forensic accounting, and analytical skills to various client situations. As an intern, Ankura will provide the opportunity to experience a variety of projects working collaboratively on small, diverse teams with skilled, intelligent, driven, and successful individuals.
Turnaround & Restructuring: T&R is an exciting, fast-paced environment in which our professionals’ partner with clients to address critical issues including over-levered balance sheets, liquidity constraints, unprofitable business units, and adverse industry conditions. Clients rely on Ankura professionals to solve complex challenges with the expectation that they will quickly assess the situation, develop a strategic plan, and effectively execute the turnaround. Our Summer Interns will be an integral part of our project teams.
Qualifications: Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Business Analytics, MIS, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or another analytical area of study; analytical problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset; ability to utilize technology to solve complex problems

Ankura is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment where mutual respect and collaboration is paramount. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, protected veteran status, national origin, or any other legally protected status.

title: Corporate Strategy Intern
requirements:
Corporate Strategy Intern

Corporate Development and Strategy Team | Chegg
Remote, United States

Your goal - to improve the education process and better the lives of students -- by interning in Chegg’s Corporate Development and Strategy group.

Organization: Corporate Development and Strategy

The Corporate Development and Strategy team is an integral part of Chegg - We work closely with the C-team to develop and execute the company’s overall strategy. Execution of strategy includes making decisions around whether the company should buy, build or partner, and therefore is closely tied to the Corporate Development function. Our small team is comprised of analysts, strategists, thought leaders, relationship builders, and dealmakers. The team drives to an understanding of relevant markets, builds out the landscape, sources deals, negotiates and closes transactions, and then develops and manages the integration plan. We also conduct market and competitive research into education trends and areas of future opportunity.

Role: Corporate Development and Strategy Intern

We’re looking for a highly motivated intern to help our team work on strategic projects in concert with the company’s business and product leaders. You will conduct research in support of our strategic roadmap and work across a number of business units, including Learning Services, Skills, and Life. The right candidate will be a self-starter with strong organizational skills and have the ability to think critically about industry and company trends.

Responsibilities
Research EdTech trends to help determine areas of opportunity and further develop our thesis on the education market and its competitive landscape
Analyze other education companies and make assessments regarding their potential as partners, competitors, investment candidates, or acquisition opportunities
Support strategic initiatives such as international expansion, product and audience expansion, partnerships, and investment opportunities
Partner with business and product leaders to develop business cases
Present key findings and recommendations to executives

Requirements
A rising sophomore or junior currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in business, finance, economics, or a related field from an accredited four-year college or university
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder).
Have the ability to work for a continuous 12 weeks in the summer
Have the ability to work 40 hours per week
Strong analytical and communication skills
Advanced knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)
Self-motivated; independent, organized and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple teams; interest in Chegg’s mission
Ability to think critically and work autonomously in both well-defined and ambiguous project environments

Nice To Have
Experience with market research and business analysis
Demonstrated passion for education and technology
Project or internship experience in investment banking, private equity, venture capital, or consulting
Project or internship experience in the education industry
What project will the intern work on?

The strategy intern will support a variety of initiatives, including contributing to the strategic planning of Chegg’s expansion into new international markets for our Learning Services and Skills business units and new non-academic verticals related to our Life business unit. Through primary and secondary research, the intern will develop an understanding of our focus markets, map the competitive landscape in each of these markets, and meaningfully shape Chegg’s entry strategy in these markets. Through their support of these initiatives, the intern will work closely with the Strategy & Corporate development team, as well as cross-functionally with a variety of Chegg’s business units.

What skills will the intern gain?
Advanced Excel
Market research
Business analysis
Basic accounting

See what it’s like to be a Chegg intern!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cp1m_ZtOT_4

Learn more about Chegg!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YYHnkwiD7Oo

About Chegg

Chegg puts students first. As the leading connected learning platform, the company makes higher education more affordable, more accessible, and more successful for students. Chegg is a publicly-held company based in Santa Clara, California, and trades on the NYSE under the symbol CHGG. For more information, visit www.chegg.com.

Chegg is an equal opportunity employer

United States Remote: This is a remote position which may be performed anywhere in the United States except for within the state of Colorado.

Risk, Forensics & Compliance: An ideal intern candidate should have an interest in forensic accounting, investigations, litigation consulting, as well as other related areas described above. Responsibilities will include applying technical accounting, forensic accounting, and analytical skills to various client situations. As an intern, Ankura will provide the opportunity to experience a variety of projects working collaboratively on small, diverse teams with skilled, intelligent, driven, and successful individuals.
Turnaround & Restructuring: T&R is an exciting, fast-paced environment in which our professionals’ partner with clients to address critical issues including over-levered balance sheets, liquidity constraints, unprofitable business units, and adverse industry conditions. Clients rely on Ankura professionals to solve complex challenges with the expectation that they will quickly assess the situation, develop a strategic plan, and effectively execute the turnaround. Our Summer Interns will be an integral part of our project teams.
Qualifications: Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Business Analytics, MIS, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or another analytical area of study; analytical problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset; ability to utilize technology to solve complex problems

Ankura is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment where mutual respect and collaboration is paramount. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, protected veteran status, national origin, or any other legally protected status.

title: Corporate Strategy Intern
requirements:
Corporate Strategy Intern

Corporate Development and Strategy Team | Chegg
Remote, United States

Your goal - to improve the education process and better the lives of students -- by interning in Chegg’s Corporate Development and Strategy group.

Organization: Corporate Development and Strategy

The Corporate Development and Strategy team is an integral part of Chegg - We work closely with the C-team to develop and execute the company’s overall strategy. Execution of strategy includes making decisions around whether the company should buy, build or partner, and therefore is closely tied to the Corporate Development function. Our small team is comprised of analysts, strategists, thought leaders, relationship builders, and dealmakers. The team drives to an understanding of relevant markets, builds out the landscape, sources deals, negotiates and closes transactions, and then develops and manages the integration plan. We also conduct market and competitive research into education trends and areas of future opportunity.

Role: Corporate Development and Strategy Intern

We’re looking for a highly motivated intern to help our team work on strategic projects in concert with the company’s business and product leaders. You will conduct research in support of our strategic roadmap and work across a number of business units, including Learning Services, Skills, and Life. The right candidate will be a self-starter with strong organizational skills and have the ability to think critically about industry and company trends.

Responsibilities
Research EdTech trends to help determine areas of opportunity and further develop our thesis on the education market and its competitive landscape
Analyze other education companies and make assessments regarding their potential as partners, competitors, investment candidates, or acquisition opportunities
Support strategic initiatives such as international expansion, product and audience expansion, partnerships, and investment opportunities
Partner with business and product leaders to develop business cases
Present key findings and recommendations to executives

Requirements
A rising sophomore or junior currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in business, finance, economics, or a related field from an accredited four-year college or university
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder).
Have the ability to work for a continuous 12 weeks in the summer
Have the ability to work 40 hours per week
Strong analytical and communication skills
Advanced knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)
Self-motivated; independent, organized and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple teams; interest in Chegg’s mission
Ability to think critically and work autonomously in both well-defined and ambiguous project environments

Nice To Have
Experience with market research and business analysis
Demonstrated passion for education and technology
Project or internship experience in investment banking, private equity, venture capital, or consulting
Project or internship experience in the education industry
What project will the intern work on?

The strategy intern will support a variety of initiatives, including contributing to the strategic planning of Chegg’s expansion into new international markets for our Learning Services and Skills business units and new non-academic verticals related to our Life business unit. Through primary and secondary research, the intern will develop an understanding of our focus markets, map the competitive landscape in each of these markets, and meaningfully shape Chegg’s entry strategy in these markets. Through their support of these initiatives, the intern will work closely with the Strategy & Corporate development team, as well as cross-functionally with a variety of Chegg’s business units.

What skills will the intern gain?
Advanced Excel
Market research
Business analysis
Basic accounting

See what it’s like to be a Chegg intern!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cp1m_ZtOT_4

Learn more about Chegg!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YYHnkwiD7Oo

About Chegg

Chegg puts students first. As the leading connected learning platform, the company makes higher education more affordable, more accessible, and more successful for students. Chegg is a publicly-held company based in Santa Clara, California, and trades on the NYSE under the symbol CHGG. For more information, visit www.chegg.com.

Chegg is an equal opportunity employer

United States Remote: This is a remote position which may be performed anywhere in the United States except for within the state of Colorado.

The Corporate Development and Strategy team is an integral part of Chegg - We work closely with the C-team to develop and execute the company’s overall strategy. Execution of strategy includes making decisions around whether the company should buy, build or partner, and therefore is closely tied to the Corporate Development function. Our small team is comprised of analysts, strategists, thought leaders, relationship builders, and dealmakers. The team drives to an understanding of relevant markets, builds out the landscape, sources deals, negotiates and closes transactions, and then develops and manages the integration plan. We also conduct market and competitive research into education trends and areas of future opportunity.

Role: Corporate Development and Strategy Intern

We’re looking for a highly motivated intern to help our team work on strategic projects in concert with the company’s business and product leaders. You will conduct research in support of our strategic roadmap and work across a number of business units, including Learning Services, Skills, and Life. The right candidate will be a self-starter with strong organizational skills and have the ability to think critically about industry and company trends.

Responsibilities
Research EdTech trends to help determine areas of opportunity and further develop our thesis on the education market and its competitive landscape
Analyze other education companies and make assessments regarding their potential as partners, competitors, investment candidates, or acquisition opportunities
Support strategic initiatives such as international expansion, product and audience expansion, partnerships, and investment opportunities
Partner with business and product leaders to develop business cases
Present key findings and recommendations to executives

Requirements
A rising sophomore or junior currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in business, finance, economics, or a related field from an accredited four-year college or university
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder).
Have the ability to work for a continuous 12 weeks in the summer
Have the ability to work 40 hours per week
Strong analytical and communication skills
Advanced knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)
Self-motivated; independent, organized and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple teams; interest in Chegg’s mission
Ability to think critically and work autonomously in both well-defined and ambiguous project environments

Nice To Have
Experience with market research and business analysis
Demonstrated passion for education and technology
Project or internship experience in investment banking, private equity, venture capital, or consulting
Project or internship experience in the education industry
What project will the intern work on?

The strategy intern will support a variety of initiatives, including contributing to the strategic planning of Chegg’s expansion into new international markets for our Learning Services and Skills business units and new non-academic verticals related to our Life business unit. Through primary and secondary research, the intern will develop an understanding of our focus markets, map the competitive landscape in each of these markets, and meaningfully shape Chegg’s entry strategy in these markets. Through their support of these initiatives, the intern will work closely with the Strategy & Corporate development team, as well as cross-functionally with a variety of Chegg’s business units.

What skills will the intern gain?
Advanced Excel
Market research
Business analysis
Basic accounting

See what it’s like to be a Chegg intern!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cp1m_ZtOT_4

Learn more about Chegg!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YYHnkwiD7Oo

About Chegg

Chegg puts students first. As the leading connected learning platform, the company makes higher education more affordable, more accessible, and more successful for students. Chegg is a publicly-held company based in Santa Clara, California, and trades on the NYSE under the symbol CHGG. For more information, visit www.chegg.com.

Chegg is an equal opportunity employer

United States Remote: This is a remote position which may be performed anywhere in the United States except for within the state of Colorado.

#LI- MI

title: DePaul University Campus Summer Intern
requirements:
Ankura is a team of excellence founded on innovation and growth.

About Ankura: Ankura is an expert services firm defined by HOW we solve challenges. Whether a client is facing an immediate business challenge, trying to increase the value of their company or protect against future risks, Ankura designs, develops, and executes tailored solutions by assembling the right combination of expertise. We build on this experience with every case, client, and situation, collaborating to create innovative, customized solutions, and strategies designed for today’s ever-changing business environment. This gives our clients unparalleled insight and experience across a wide range of economic, governance, and regulatory challenges. At Ankura, we know that collaboration drives results.

Position: Ankura Summer Intern

Description: The Summer Internship Program has been created to give students an opportunity to learn what life as a consultant is like at Ankura. As an Intern, you will work on a variety of projects with different engagement teams. The program aims to give you exposure to the breadth of our services and client work. You will work closely with our professionals – Consultants through Director – and gain first-hand experience in consulting.

Business Groups
Construction, Disputes & Advisory: As a Construction Intern, you will develop analytical skills while being immersed in the world of client services. Construction Interns work directly with project team leaders and experts, assisting our experts in performing the detailed analyses required to provide the best solutions for our clients. Interns perform project schedule, cost, productivity, and statistical analyses as well as assist with review of key project issues through document review and database creation/management.
Data & Technology: Interns will be engaged on a variety of projects, internal initiatives, training opportunities and technical challenges, office-wide intern projects, and various social events. The internship program is focused on providing interns with the opportunity to learn about Ankura and the industry, learn and utilize new skills, and develop relationships. Interns will have the opportunity to learn, use, or gain exposure to a wide variety of programs, platforms, and programming languages, including SQL, Python, C#, VBA, and Tableau.
Disputes & Economics: Intern assignments will involve work in fact-finding, allocating costs, analyzing damages, organizing information, or helping to manage data. You will also learn new skills and participate in social and volunteer activities throughout the summer.
Risk, Forensics & Compliance: An ideal intern candidate should have an interest in forensic accounting, investigations, litigation consulting, as well as other related areas described above. Responsibilities will include applying technical accounting, forensic accounting, and analytical skills to various client situations. As an intern, Ankura will provide the opportunity to experience a variety of projects working collaboratively on small, diverse teams with skilled, intelligent, driven, and successful individuals.
Turnaround & Restructuring: T&R is an exciting, fast-paced environment in which our professionals’ partner with clients to address critical issues including over-levered balance sheets, liquidity constraints, unprofitable business units, and adverse industry conditions. Clients rely on Ankura professionals to solve complex challenges with the expectation that they will quickly assess the situation, develop a strategic plan, and effectively execute the turnaround. Our Summer Interns will be an integral part of our project teams.
Qualifications: Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Business Analytics, MIS, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or another analytical area of study; analytical problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset; ability to utilize technology to solve complex problems

Ankura is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment where mutual respect and collaboration is paramount. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, protected veteran status, national origin, or any other legally protected status.

Through primary and secondary research, the intern will develop an understanding of our focus markets, map the competitive landscape in each of these markets, and meaningfully shape Chegg’s entry strategy in these markets. Through their support of these initiatives, the intern will work closely with the Strategy & Corporate development team, as well as cross-functionally with a variety of Chegg’s business units.

#LI- MI

title: Indiana University Campus Summer Intern
requirements:
Ankura is a team of excellence founded on innovation and growth.

About Ankura: Ankura is an expert services firm defined by HOW we solve challenges. Whether a client is facing an immediate business challenge, trying to increase the value of their company or protect against future risks, Ankura designs, develops, and executes tailored solutions by assembling the right combination of expertise. We build on this experience with every case, client, and situation, collaborating to create innovative, customized solutions, and strategies designed for today’s ever-changing business environment. This gives our clients unparalleled insight and experience across a wide range of economic, governance, and regulatory challenges. At Ankura, we know that collaboration drives results.

Position: Ankura Summer Intern

Description: The Summer Internship Program has been created to give students an opportunity to learn what life as a consultant is like at Ankura. As an Intern, you will work on a variety of projects with different engagement teams. The program aims to give you exposure to the breadth of our services and client work. You will work closely with our professionals – Consultants through Director – and gain first-hand experience in consulting.

Business Groups
Construction, Disputes & Advisory: As a Construction Intern, you will develop analytical skills while being immersed in the world of client services. Construction Interns work directly with project team leaders and experts, assisting our experts in performing the detailed analyses required to provide the best solutions for our clients. Interns perform project schedule, cost, productivity, and statistical analyses as well as assist with review of key project issues through document review and database creation/management.
Data & Technology: Interns will be engaged on a variety of projects, internal initiatives, training opportunities and technical challenges, office-wide intern projects, and various social events. The internship program is focused on providing interns with the opportunity to learn about Ankura and the industry, learn and utilize new skills, and develop relationships. Interns will have the opportunity to learn, use, or gain exposure to a wide variety of programs, platforms, and programming languages, including SQL, Python, C#, VBA, and Tableau.
Disputes & Economics: Intern assignments will involve work in fact-finding, allocating costs, analyzing damages, organizing information, or helping to manage data. You will also learn new skills and participate in social and volunteer activities throughout the summer.
Risk, Forensics & Compliance: An ideal intern candidate should have an interest in forensic accounting, investigations, litigation consulting, as well as other related areas described above. Responsibilities will include applying technical accounting, forensic accounting, and analytical skills to various client situations. As an intern, Ankura will provide the opportunity to experience a variety of projects working collaboratively on small, diverse teams with skilled, intelligent, driven, and successful individuals.
Turnaround & Restructuring: T&R is an exciting, fast-paced environment in which our professionals’ partner with clients to address critical issues including over-levered balance sheets, liquidity constraints, unprofitable business units, and adverse industry conditions. Clients rely on Ankura professionals to solve complex challenges with the expectation that they will quickly assess the situation, develop a strategic plan, and effectively execute the turnaround. Our Summer Interns will be an integral part of our project teams.
Qualifications: Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Business Analytics, MIS, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or another analytical area of study; analytical problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset; ability to utilize technology to solve complex problems

Ankura is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment where mutual respect and collaboration is paramount. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, protected veteran status, national origin, or any other legally protected status.

title: Corporate Strategy Intern
requirements:
Corporate Strategy Intern

Corporate Development and Strategy Team | Chegg
Remote, United States

Your goal - to improve the education process and better the lives of students -- by interning in Chegg’s Corporate Development and Strategy group.

Organization: Corporate Development and Strategy

The Corporate Development and Strategy team is an integral part of Chegg - We work closely with the C-team to develop and execute the company’s overall strategy. Execution of strategy includes making decisions around whether the company should buy, build or partner, and therefore is closely tied to the Corporate Development function. Our small team is comprised of analysts, strategists, thought leaders, relationship builders, and dealmakers. The team drives to an understanding of relevant markets, builds out the landscape, sources deals, negotiates and closes transactions, and then develops and manages the integration plan. We also conduct market and competitive research into education trends and areas of future opportunity.

Role: Corporate Development and Strategy Intern

We’re looking for a highly motivated intern to help our team work on strategic projects in concert with the company’s business and product leaders. You will conduct research in support of our strategic roadmap and work across a number of business units, including Learning Services, Skills, and Life. The right candidate will be a self-starter with strong organizational skills and have the ability to think critically about industry and company trends.

Responsibilities
Research EdTech trends to help determine areas of opportunity and further develop our thesis on the education market and its competitive landscape
Analyze other education companies and make assessments regarding their potential as partners, competitors, investment candidates, or acquisition opportunities
Support strategic initiatives such as international expansion, product and audience expansion, partnerships, and investment opportunities
Partner with business and product leaders to develop business cases
Present key findings and recommendations to executives

Requirements
A rising sophomore or junior currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in business, finance, economics, or a related field from an accredited four-year college or university
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder).
Have the ability to work for a continuous 12 weeks in the summer
Have the ability to work 40 hours per week
Strong analytical and communication skills
Advanced knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)
Self-motivated; independent, organized and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple teams; interest in Chegg’s mission
Ability to think critically and work autonomously in both well-defined and ambiguous project environments

Nice To Have
Experience with market research and business analysis
Demonstrated passion for education and technology
Project or internship experience in investment banking, private equity, venture capital, or consulting
Project or internship experience in the education industry
What project will the intern work on?

The strategy intern will support a variety of initiatives, including contributing to the strategic planning of Chegg’s expansion into new international markets for our Learning Services and Skills business units and new non-academic verticals related to our Life business unit. Through primary and secondary research, the intern will develop an understanding of our focus markets, map the competitive landscape in each of these markets, and meaningfully shape Chegg’s entry strategy in these markets. Through their support of these initiatives, the intern will work closely with the Strategy & Corporate development team, as well as cross-functionally with a variety of Chegg’s business units.

What skills will the intern gain?
Advanced Excel
Market research
Business analysis
Basic accounting

#LI- MI

title: University Intern, Forensic Accounting
requirements:
Ankura is a team of excellence founded on innovation and growth.

This position supports the Ankura Risk, Forensics, & Compliance Business Group - one of six practices focused on client delivery services across the Firm.

Ankura’s Dallas Forensics Practice Provide Clients With Expertise With Investigations & Accounting Advisory And Litigation, Arbitration, & Disputes, Which Includes
Forensic Accounting and Financial Investigations
Accounting, Fraud and Independent Fact-Finding Investigations
Ponzi Schemes, Whistleblower, Embezzlement, and Kickback Matters
Forensic Accounting and Reconstruction of Books and Records
Purchase Price Disputes
Commercial Litigation
International Arbitration
Damages Analysis
Expert Services
Business Valuation Dispute Analysis
An ideal intern candidate should have an interest in forensic accounting, investigations, litigation consulting, as well as other related areas described above. Responsibilities will include applying technical accounting, forensic accounting, and analytical skills to various client situations. As an intern, Ankura will provide the opportunity to experience a variety of projects working collaboratively on small, diverse teams with skilled, intelligent, driven, and successful individuals. Ankura is focused on hiring people that will serve as the foundation of a growing firm dedicated to its people and culture while delivering high quality service to our clients.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Ankura’s Winter Internship Program has been created to give students an opportunity to learn what life is like as a consultant in our Dallas Forensics Practice. As an intern, we will expect you to function like a full time Associate and as such you will become intimately familiar with your clients' big-picture objectives and challenges, as well as have a thorough understanding of the nuances associated with their financial books and records. You will work closely with all levels of our professionals – Associates through Senior Managing Director – and gain first-hand experience in consulting and advisory services. You will be responsible for performing accounting-related analyses and conveying your results to internal project leads.

Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following:
Applying accounting, financial, and analytical skills to various client issues, such as, detailed analysis of transactional data, underlying books and records, and financial statements, tracing of flow of funds, calculations of damages in complex disputes, review of revenue recognition procedures, etc.
Assist with designing and implementing analysis, investigation, and project specific workplans
Developing and performing analyses to assess complex fact patterns and preparing reports and schedules summarizing findings for review by senior colleagues and clients
Documenting and maintaining detailed workpaper records that reflect assumptions, information sources, and methodologies and procedures underlying all analytical tasks
Ensuring delivery of high-quality work product and deliverables within established timeframes and budgets
Performing day-to-day client engagement activities, including interaction with internal Ankura team members and other stakeholders involved in the engagement developing productive working relationships with colleagues and clients
Contributing to the overall success of the firm by participating in pitches, proposals, internal and external networking events, marketing the firm externally to prospective clients, and corporate social responsibility events

Basic Qualifications
Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree or Master’s Degree in accounting, finance, or related field
Applicants should have an interest to pursue a CPA license upon graduation and completion of state requirements

Required Skills & Characteristics
Ability to work well independently, as well as collaboratively with colleagues
Possess strong team-oriented personality characteristics: hard-working, thoughtful, and collaborative, with a positive outlook and confidence
Possess excellent communication (verbal and written), computer, and organizational skills, and strong quantitative and qualitative analytical, mathematical, and research skills
Ability to adapt quickly in handling multiple, evolving tasks and/or engagements, and re-prioritized deadlines in an always changing environment
Highly motivated, eager to learn, willing to travel as needed, and able to motivate others
Technical accounting, financial, and economic skills, along with familiarity and knowledge of application of SEC rules, regulations, and disclosures
Understanding of and experience with application and/or research of U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (“U.S. GAAP”) and/or generally accepting auditing standards (“GAAS”)
Proficient with PC environments and related software, including Microsoft Office applications, specifically advanced skills in Microsoft Excel
Ankura is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment where mutual respect and collaboration is paramount. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, protected veteran status, national origin, or any other legally protected status.

Corporate Development and Strategy Team | Chegg
Remote, United States

Your goal - to improve the education process and better the lives of students -- by interning in Chegg’s Corporate Development and Strategy group.

Organization: Corporate Development and Strategy

The Corporate Development and Strategy team is an integral part of Chegg - We work closely with the C-team to develop and execute the company’s overall strategy. Execution of strategy includes making decisions around whether the company should buy, build or partner, and therefore is closely tied to the Corporate Development function. Our small team is comprised of analysts, strategists, thought leaders, relationship builders, and dealmakers. The team drives to an understanding of relevant markets, builds out the landscape, sources deals, negotiates and closes transactions, and then develops and manages the integration plan. We also conduct market and competitive research into education trends and areas of future opportunity.

Role: Corporate Development and Strategy Intern

We’re looking for a highly motivated intern to help our team work on strategic projects in concert with the company’s business and product leaders. You will conduct research in support of our strategic roadmap and work across a number of business units, including Learning Services, Skills, and Life. The right candidate will be a self-starter with strong organizational skills and have the ability to think critically about industry and company trends.

Responsibilities
Research EdTech trends to help determine areas of opportunity and further develop our thesis on the education market and its competitive landscape
Analyze other education companies and make assessments regarding their potential as partners, competitors, investment candidates, or acquisition opportunities
Support strategic initiatives such as international expansion, product and audience expansion, partnerships, and investment opportunities
Partner with business and product leaders to develop business cases
Present key findings and recommendations to executives

Requirements
A rising sophomore or junior currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in business, finance, economics, or a related field from an accredited four-year college or university
Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder).
Have the ability to work for a continuous 12 weeks in the summer
Have the ability to work 40 hours per week
Strong analytical and communication skills
Advanced knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)
Self-motivated; independent, organized and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple teams; interest in Chegg’s mission
Ability to think critically and work autonomously in both well-defined and ambiguous project environments

Nice To Have
Experience with market research and business analysis
Demonstrated passion for education and technology
Project or internship experience in investment banking, private equity, venture capital, or consulting
Project or internship experience in the education industry
What project will the intern work on?

The strategy intern will support a variety of initiatives, including contributing to the strategic planning of Chegg’s expansion into new international markets for our Learning Services and Skills business units and new non-academic verticals related to our Life business unit. Through primary and secondary research, the intern will develop an understanding of our focus markets, map the competitive landscape in each of these markets, and meaningfully shape Chegg’s entry strategy in these markets. Through their support of these initiatives, the intern will work closely with the Strategy & Corporate development team, as well as cross-functionally with a variety of Chegg’s business units.

What skills will the intern gain?
Advanced Excel
Market research
Business analysis
Basic accounting

See what it’s like to be a Chegg intern!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cp1m_ZtOT_4

Learn more about Chegg!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YYHnkwiD7Oo

About Chegg

Chegg puts students first. As the leading connected learning platform, the company makes higher education more affordable, more accessible, and more successful for students. Chegg is a publicly-held company based in Santa Clara, California, and trades on the NYSE under the symbol CHGG. For more information, visit www.chegg.com.

Chegg is an equal opportunity employer

United States Remote: This is a remote position which may be performed anywhere in the United States except for within the state of Colorado.

#LI- MI

title: Summer Intern – Implementation Consulting Intern
requirements:
Our Company

Medidata is leading the digital transformation of life sciences with the world's most-used platform for clinical development, commercial and real-world data. Powered by artificial intelligence and delivered by #1 ranked industry experts, the Intelligent Platform for Life Sciences helps pharmaceutical, biotech, medical device companies and academic researchers accelerate value, minimize risk and optimize outcomes. Medidata serves more than 1,000 customers and partners worldwide and empowers more than 100,000 certified users every day to create hope for millions of patients. Discover the future of life sciences: www.mdsol.com

We know that diverse teams win and are fully committed to selecting leaders and employees that represent the markets in which we operate. We are still led by our Co-founders, Tarek Sherif and Glen de Vries, and have global operations in the US, Europe and Asia with over 2000 employees.

Medidata is making a real difference in the lives of patients everywhere by accelerating critical drug and medical device development, enabling life-saving drugs and medical devices to get to market faster. Our products sit at the convergence of the Technology and Life Sciences industries, one of most exciting areas for global innovation. Nine of the top 10 best-selling drugs in 2017 were developed on the Medidata platform.

Medidata’s solutions have powered over 14,000 clinical trials giving us the largest collection of clinical trial data in the world. With this asset, we pioneer innovative, advanced applications and intelligent data analytics, bringing an unmatched level of quality and efficiency to clinical trials enabling treatments to reach waiting patients sooner.

The Program

At Medidata, interns will have the opportunity to accelerate their careers by working closely with experienced professionals and gain valuable, hands-on, full-time work experience. By being a part of our global organization, interns have the opportunity to work alongside our talented and committed professionals helping them to build a strong foundation for achieving their career goals. For 12 weeks, beginning May 24, 2021, interns will have an opportunity to gain a deep understanding of what it means to be a Medidatian. United around a single goal of empowering smarter treatments and healthier people. Medidatians work in a culture of curiosity, innovation and fun. You will be contributing to the line of business with sustainable and meaningful work.

Our Summer Internship program also includes instructor led training, guided mentorship, exposure to senior leadership and community service. In addition to individual and specific related responsibilities, each intern will participate in our Intern Innovation Lab. Assigned to cross-functional teams, interns will work closely to develop an innovative solution to a business problem currently facing Medidata. As they work diligently to present their final solutions to a panel of top Medidata leaders, we are confident that our interns will make a significant impact on our business.

The Position

As an Implementation Consultant Team Member, we’ll invite you to work with the industry leading software in the clinical trial space. You will gain exposure to how the professional services team interacts with and delivers technology to our customer base.

With Senior Mentorship, You’ll Pair On Projects Like
Client Engagement Documentation & Delivery
Configuration Testing
Cross Functional Knowledge Sharing
Business Process Improvement Initiatives

Qualifications / Competencies
Problem Solver
Interest in Learning New Software
Relationship Builder
High Attention to Detail
Inquisitive Nature
Willingness to Learn
Medidata Solutions, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Medidata Solutions provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by the law. Medidata Solutions complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

title: Supply Chain Consulting Analyst - Intern
requirements:
Overview
 We are looking for a highly motivated candidate to join our firm’s NYC team and help us take on exciting new projects. We strive for consummate professionals who have high levels of academic and professional achievement, great communication skills, a keen analytical mindset and an interest in a consulting career. Fascination with the supply chain/logistics is a plus while a hard-working, positive and eager-to-learn mentality is a must. Due to the current COVID-19 situation, this role would be remote. This will be a paid internship and based on the outcome, there is potential for a permanent role with the company.
 About Establish
 Establish is an international management consulting firm focusing on supply chain management. We work with the most exciting clients and complete projects that make a difference. See our client list https://www.establishinc.com/clients and case studies https://www.establishinc.com/case-studies/supply-chain-strategy for more information.
 When & Where
 The ideal candidate would be able to start in early June 2021. The internship will last until the beginning of August 2021, with the potential to extend longer. The team that you would be working with is based out of NYC, however, due to the current COVID-19 conditions, we are working remotely. The candidate would be expected to be able to work remotely for the immediate future.
 Typical Job Responsibilities
 This internship position will be expected to provide analytical support to their project team throughout client projects. Typical responsibilities include;
 Cleansing raw data sets from client ERP systems (sales, freight, inventory, transactions, etc.).
Analyzing, synthesizing, finding patterns and drawing conclusions from the data sets to develop summaries, business profiles and find actionable insights.
Using data visualization tools to transform data sets into presentable visuals.
Developing and improving standard data analytics processes and procedures.
Assisting in the development of distribution network models to evaluate cost, service and flexibility by determining the optimal number and location of warehouses, inventory levels and distribution strategies.
Building quantitative tables and indexes that support our internal tools.
Conducting research on market trends within the supply chain industry.
Participating in both internal meetings and client meetings.
Assisting in building client presentations and reports.
 Other responsibilities may include;
 Mapping current-state supply chain or warehouse processes, creating improved processes, implementing the changes and quantifying savings.
Conducting Supply Chain Best Practice Audits.
Assisting in creating the operating design of plants and distribution centers, including the physical layout, workflows/SOPs, volumes, headcount, material handling equipment requirements, IT systems, costs and plan to implement the design.
 The Ideal Candidate
 Is attending a top university pursuing a degree in a technical discipline.
Has an interest in the supply chain/logistics and consulting industries and a knack for data.
Has experience with analytical toolsets like SQL, Excel and R.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, PowerBI or Looker.
Exposure/familiarity with Lean and Six Sigma methodologies.
Experience with AutoCAD or other design suites is a plus.
Has impressive communication skills and is comfortable presenting to high-ranking members of the client team about logical, unbiased, analytical findings and recommendations.
Has a positive, can-do attitude, the ability to work independently and without direction and is eager to learn new things and be exposed to different industries.
Feels at home both in distribution centers, operations and corporate offices.

title: Pharmaceutical Consulting Intern
requirements:
Innovative Science Solutions (ISS)a Cello Health business is a boutique scientific consulting company serving the worldwide pharmaceutical, biotechnology, medical device, cosmetics, food, and dietary supplement industries. We are a team of scientists, regulatory strategists, and consultants providing a wide range of fully integrated scientific consulting services to both industry and counsel. From FDA Advisory Committee meetings to support of complex, science-based litigation, ISS delivers specialized solutions for business hurdles. For more information about our firm visit us at www.innovativescience.net.

You have high expectations for yourself and your career, so does ISS. Imagine what we will achieve together.

Responsibilities
Identify and analyze clinical/regulatory information to support a variety of projects
Scientific literature searching and curation
Database management and implementation
Evaluate accuracy and quality of work product deliverables
Learn to conceive and formulate effective marketing strategies designed to sell our company’s services


Requirements

The ideal candidate is inquisitive, ambitious, hardworking and has a strong interest in the healthcare field, including the following characteristics
Pursuing a degree in a life science or related field
Interest in regulatory affairs, medical affairs or clinical research
Proficient and comfortable with scientific/medical data and nomenclature
Desire to become proficient in effectively communicating complex scientific and regulatory principles to non-scientists (as well as to scientists and healthcare professionals)
Proficient with Word, Outlook, Excel, and PowerPoint
Expert skills in internet searching and web browsing
Eagerness to work independently and in teams in a fast-paced environment
Extremely comfortable reviewing and interpreting scientific charts, tables and figures
Passion for producing and presenting scientific data in oral presentations or written reports
